text: I love this place, I have checked in 3 times but you can bet I have been here at least 30. The food is great. The drinks are always good and dont forget to use the Yelp offer for free edamame when you go.

I had lunch one time and the sushi was pretty good but I think they're overpriced for a lunch menu. I can get sushi just as good 4 miles down the road for a lot less. The restaurant itself is very clean and has nice decor. The staff was also very friendly.

The food was very good, the service excellent (I really liked our waitress). Some of the sushi came a tad slow and they did forget a roll we ordered. That said, I'd definitely go again. The I love salmon roll was outstanding as was the red blossom roll. There was also an issue with the restroom but overall I would give it a B+ and am sure it will only get better from here!

The atmosphere at Otaku was wonderful! This was my first time coming here and all of the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. As soon as I walked in I noticed how amazing decorations are and got the feeling that it was a more upscale restaurant. The whole place was very lively and fun, definitely not stuffy.  This was only my first time eating sushi, or even any type or seafood, so I wasn't really sure what to order. The menu was huge and had so many choices things to order so I decided to ask what the waitress recommended. The waitress was very friendly and after asking what kinds of foods I liked she recommended I get the spicy tuna roll with rice paper instead of seaweed. The presentation of the sushi was quite nice. However, I was not a fan of how the sushi actually tasted.   This being my first time trying sushi, I was not impressed. It could have been that I just don't like the taste of sushi because the other people I was with seemed to enjoy their meal. The food was definitely a little pricy, but the atmosphere and friendly wait staff was spectacular. I had a wonderful experience for my first time at Otaku and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys sushi.

Beautiful place! Unfortunately, the food was only mediocre. Went with a groupon and the waiter was nice enough to ring up two separate tickets for us, since we couldn't use our groupon on happy hour items. We got the Las Vegas Roll, which was not very good. We also had edamame, which was good (hard to mess that up). For our entrees, we had the Mongolian Beef and Combination Chow  Mein. Both were very heavy handed with salt. Probably the worst part was the manager, who spent quite a bit of time at a table in our area. He was very loud and overly assertive with his authority. At one point, he called our waiter over to have him fill their water glasses whereas a good manager would have taken care of it himself. He seemed eager to impress the patrons of the table. A bit later, he commented "That's how we do it at Otaku." Ew! Obnoxious! Overall, not somewhere we will go again.

This is only my second review on Yelp and I'm reserving my judgement on the whole idea of Yelp due to  my first post being removed from the site for reasons unknown.  That being said, we had dinner last night at Otaku - we've been there in the past, enjoyed it and decided to visit them again.  We enjoyed the sushi - it was very good - Ben and Jesus were fun to talk to with and we found our taste in fish very similar.  The service was great, our beer glasses filled when needed and we felt very welcomed.  We will definitely go back to see what other specials they have to offer.

Nice decor and tasteful layout.   Went there for lunch and the food was nothing spectacular.   Service was rather slow, given that there was'nt much of a lunch crowd.    The sushi was just ok, have tasted better and the Bento box was interesting but nothing to write home about.  In summary great place if you have a GroupOn or for Happy Hour

Went to Otaku last night (3/5/11) - it was horrible.  It took us an hour to get a noodle bowl - how long does it take to cook noodles?  It was SO salty it was inedible.  We did not eat it, paid for our drinks, and left.    The service was also terrible!  They did not have enough menus to go around, we had to share.  They didn't have enough forks so I had to wait 10 min to eat (yes, I eat Asian food with a fork).  I actually wish they had never found me a fork so I wouldn't have found out how awful the food was.    One more place near home that I will never go to again...it's too bad.

Went here for the first time and loved it. The server was super knowledgable and friendly. The atmosphere was great as well.   Finally, I tried two specialty rolls( the cheetah and the fire in the mouth roll) And my girlfriend got an order of chicken teriyaki and everything tasted great! Definitely quality and reasonably priced. Would definitely recommend to friends.

Ambiance:  Its a brand new restaurant in a new area and the setting is very nice. I dont quite get the dark brown chairs with the black tables (maybe it was dark when the purchase decision was made?) and I probably wouldnt have introduced all the golden fixtures which makes a somewhat kitchy in my opinion but nevertheless is a nice and modern decor.  Food: Had a bento box lunch here the other day and the food is just really good. You can really taste the fish and other components of the sushi and the honey chicken I had was also very tasteful.  Their own blend of soy sauce just adds a very nice touch to the food.  Service: There was more staff than there were customers so the service was pretty good.  Overall:  We live right around the corner and we're sushi addicts so we'll definately be back. Otaku is a little pricey though so it might not be for our weekly sushi run but I hope they'll stick around for a long time.

Went for lunch. It was our 1st time here. Nice atmosphere and the place looked very clean. They have a large menu with a variety of Asian food options. We had the shrimp tempura roll, regular California roll and a snow crab California roll. All were really fresh. Service was friendly, helpful and attentive. If your looking for a nice sushi place in this area, give Otaku a try.

I went to Otaku because i had never tried sushi before. I was suprised as soon as i walked in this sushi bar did not smell like raw fish. Which is one of the main reasons I had never one into a sushi place before. The resturant had an amazing atmosphere. Not extremely loud like Benihana. If you're looking for a nice quiet dinner this is the place to go.       This was my first time eating sushi, the waiters were very helpful when it came to me ordering. I choose a very generic sushi, the California roll. The food is a bit more pricey then other places i have been too, that also happen to have sushi. If you go during happy hour prices are much more reasonable though. The chow mein was the best I have ever had.       Though i did enjot the resturant, I did not enjoy the sushi. It could of just been my tastebuds though. The place was very steadily busy, and everyone looked like they enjoyed their food. I probably will not be back because I didn't enjoy the food. But i would be willing to go again for the atmosphere!

Very delicious meal- we ate the bento box for lunch- all of our food was delicious, light and fresh.  The large portions made up for the higher prices, but we did skip a drink because they were all over 9$.  We loved the environment, nice open space and lighting.

Me and my boyfriend came around 3:30 on Valentines Day to beat the crowd later. It was not busy at all so we decided to sit at the bar. The place is beautiful and you can tell they spent a lot of money on the decor. Our waitress/bartender told us that the place is beautiful at night for us to check it out sometime. I am definitely a huge sushi fan and I do go often trying new places to eat sushi so I was excited to try this place since it was close to our house. We ended up ordering two cokes and a total of five rolls since they didn't have the Kim bop roll which our waitress told us they usually run out of earlier in the week until they re-stock. So we ended up just getting five rolls since the last one ruined my night or we might have ordered more. The first three we ordered was the Las Vegas roll Happy hour price $5, Tootzy roll $5, and the Roll which was $14. All of which were delicious. These were bite size compared to how often I see others make the Las Vegas roll so huge in size. After enjoying the first three rolls we decided to try two more, the superman roll $12 and the spider roll $11. First one I tried out of the last two rolls was the Spider roll which was great since it has soft shell crab in it and that is one of our favorites. The one I had a problem with was the superman roll which is a spicy tuna/cucumber roll topped with white tuna. The first thing I tried was the white tuna on top of the roll and the second I put it into my mouth I got sick. There was just something so funny about the taste and the smell of the fish was foul. Mind you I have had white tuna many times before and never have I experience this smell and taste. My boyfriend suggested I try another bite of the roll since it may have be the sauce they put on it, so I wiped as much sauce as I could off and tried the roll again which didn't improve at all. At this point I was just plain sick & I couldn't even eat the rest of the other yummie roll we ordered.  I told my boyfriend we had to go because otherwise I would have to run to the bathroom and be sick.  So we asked our waitress for the check which they run our cards on iPads, something I haven't seen before which was cool. Our total bill came to $65 with the tip but with all the talking the bartender/waitress did she never minded to ask us how or rolls were so I made sure to let her know how sick I was before I gave her my card to pay. She informed me that white tuna is high in oil and that some people can't handle eating a fish like that and that the white tuna roll must have been us and not the them. So I informed her that I had eaten white tuna many times before and this just tasted completely foul. She did not offer us a discount which might have changed our mind in trying this place again and recommending it to our friends.  I just wanted to review this place to say how much it did make me sick enough to ruin the rest of our valentines day plans and that I am still sick the next day. We will not go back. If we do I guess it won't be for a while and we won't order the White tuna.
What a great place for sushi.   Service was second to none.  Sat outside and enjoyed well prepared entrees.  Thanks for a great night Robin

Pro:  had a groupon; cute waitresses; clean bathrooms; better than expected decor  Cons: Dirty dishes- came with a group of 4- two of the plates had food stains on it - 2 of the bowls for the soup had food particles on it - hard to get over that hump - food is mediocre and pretty tasteless  - if looking or Asian fusion, save yourself the time and money and jut head over to Pei Wei.  Flies liked our food, though

Tonight was a wonderful evening! We are visiting our grandparents from Los Angeles, and who knew the Gparents liked sushi and his is their favorite place !! We walked in to be seated right away. Codi was our server. She was very attentive and got our order in right away. She was kind to my gramma and very patient with her.  She suggested the Monster roll which we had and was delicious.  The Salmon and tuna sushi was melting in out mouth it was so fresh and delicious.  We can't wait to come back and visit and go here for all around great time!!

This place is overpriced. They're charging premium prices for mediocre food. The food and service was good, but it's not $6.50 for two pieces of sushi good. I get that importing fish to Arizona may not be cheap, but if they're going to charge that much for sushi then it better be damn good. They also stuff their rolls to the brim with rice to make them seem bigger. In the end you just end up with a fart sized amount of fish, a shit ton of rice, and a bill that might require a loan.

Pretty solid sushi spot. Came in for an early dinner and we were seated very quickly and the staff was very accommodating. We ordered the chefs nigiri, tiger roll, and edamame. The nigiri was great, clean and fresh; and the tiger roll was fantastic, not too sweet with some crunchy tempura in the center which gave it a good texture.

Well let me say when a Sushi place smells like fish you better run away. My wife and I have gone to this place 3 times and it seems like it is dying. The last time we dined for lunch and the place stank of fish the moment we walked through the door. The wait staff was over zealous in trying to upsell us. Needless to say we drive by regularly and wonder why they still are in business. Thankfully we had a groupon the last time we were there, but we still didn't feel we got our money's worth. Sorry, but here are many places better than this one.
Good but off the beaten path. If the location wasnt so weird and the prices a bit steep, Id give em 5 stars. That being said, it's worth a try....better than the big chains!
Sushi not fresh today.  This is the first time so We will try it again.  Calamari very good.

The restaurant has a nice upscale atmosphere.  We are at the bar, sampled the Moscow Mule and Martini's. I would recommend the Hot and Messy along with the I love shrimp. The Dynamite is pretty good too.
Sushi is always fresh and the fresh wasabi is great.  Service is amazing as well.  The food is always consistent. The restaurant is always clean.

Interior is nice and has that "hip" feel that most sushi places seem to be going for these days but the food was less than average which was disappointing. Dined there at lunch on a Saturday afternoon and were the only guests in the building. The biggest downside was the blaring r&b music that was so loud you couldn't have a conversation with your companions. Lots of unique and modern rolls if you enjoy that but the sashimi we had was cut so thick and had sinew running through it which was very off putting. I would probably stick to a more conventional sushi restaurant next time that focuses more on the art of sushi than trying to be hip.

It is a good place that we have enjoyed a few times. The atmosphere is pretty neat and different too. Especially for the area that is starting to be developed. Has s good menu and service seemed to be good as well.  We have no complaints.

Hmm. Went here with some friends on a Sunday night. Service was excellent. Friendly staff. Ordered orange yellowtail special and a California roll. Sushi was decent however in-house soy sauce was just absolutely horrible. If that was low sodium I don't even want to imagine the normal soy sauce. Normally I like to just add wasabi however this time I had to dilute with almost half a glass of water, the juice from a wedge of lemon and chili oil before I could consider the soy sauce minimally acceptable. Cut back on the salt or keep some Kirin on the side please!

Excellent sushi.  Had the Matador, and it was outstanding!!!  The stuffed jalape√±os for an appetizer, yum!!!  Very nice atmosphere in the restaurant, very clean.  Service was very good.  My sushi took a while, but the quality and taste more than made up for it.  I was in no rush.

Came here for Happy Hour Friday, blue moon - white ale on draft, fish was fresh, music and ambience was great, and they had a good selection of sashimi - including uni.  Service was quick and Samantha our server was friendly.
Had drinks and some happy hour sushi with the wife.  Great atmosphere and the service with good too.  I had to order one more roll and went with the big mouth and it was amazing.

We had an excellent time @ Otaku last night. A girls night out was full of laughter with an amazing fun bartender Kevin!  The food was fantastic and the service was amazing this time around!!!  We will be back for sure!!!
Great atmosphere! Amazing sushi! Great service! Our new Go-to sushi bar! Hip and modern, definately recommed!

This is a favorite spot of ours. I have yet to have anything less than spectacular. The service has always been great but today we had a young man named Tony who made our lunch experience excellent. He was very attentive without being overbearing and he was vet genuine. 5 stars for hiring a great wait staff!

I absolutely love this place, we've been going here for years. Never had a bad experience or a bad meal. Always clean friendly and all the rolls are amazing, even the cheetah roll which I wasn't sure about but we tried it and it was delicious! They even went as far as to make our anniversary and Valentine's day even more special roses, and desserts! Owners friendly and always making sure everyone is having a good experience.

This review is based on the company's response to my previous review.  One of the owners sent me a message and gave me his personal cell asking me to call him regarding my experience.  He took my call while in the middle of a vacation with his family and insisted we speak then - he took the time to fully listen to me and emphasized repeatedly the dedication they have to providing an excellent dining experience for every single patron.  I know that every business - especially restaurants can have an "off night" and after speaking with this owner, I will be pleased to give them another chance next time I'm in the PHX area.  This 5 star rating is based on the willingness of the owner to address my concerns in the way that he did... not many businesses in my experience do that and it gives me confidence that the experience in my review was simply an anomaly!

Love this sushi restaurant. He food, ambiance, the service. I was happy with all of it. Their menu has a pretty big menu. They also have lunch specials as well that isn't bad either. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
We miss the old happy hour. It's not what it used to be. The food is good if you're okay with the prices and fish portions. They should be bigger portions for the price.

we went last night for my husbands birthday dinner, I made reservations and glad because it was pretty full. We sat in the tree room which was awesome. It has a very nice decor in there. The food was really good. The service was really nice. We will definitely go again! Pretty awesome having such a cool place near our home in the boonies.
Good stuff... Not going to change the world but if you love sushi, check this place out for sure!!

Their soy sauce had a smokey flavor. Affected the taste of standard rolls.  Las Vegas roll - tasted a little like bologna, prolly because of the soy. Spicy Salmon roll - spicy and delicious Sexy Girl roll - crab meat, sweet mayo, and a slice of strawberry. Mellow, fruity, almost like a dessert.  The staff were polite, helpful.

Great looking place. Beautiful ambience. Looks better then P.F. chang but food is more like Pei Wei. Service was good, but server and restaurant is not prepared for someone who cannot eat gluten. Server went through menu saying "this is gluten free" when it obviously wasnt. He was guessing. He finally went and asked the chef and got clarification. But why not in this day and age just put it on the menu? Food though was mediocre. Had the beef ribs which were mostly bone and fat. Orange chicken wasnt that great either.

Update: This is now my Sushi Go to place. Sushi is fresh and thry usually have three  Chefs behind the bar, fast ad well. Thr scallop poppers are awesome.. Really liked the Samurai roll and Superman!!
One of our new favorite places for sushi. Service was amazing and the sushi was the freshest we have had around gilbert. Different unique rolls and we can't wait to go back.

Short story review:  Food:  2/5 Service:  5/5 Atmosphere:  4/5 Value:  2/5  =======  I recently went to this restaurant with my girlfriend for lunch.  We both love sushi and have been trying different places in the east valley.  As some of our other staples were closed on Sunday afternoon, we decided to try Otaku.  The first thing we noticed about Otaku was its nice, modern look.  The restaurant decor and layout is pretty appealing, with large glass windows separating the main dining rotunda from the patio outside.  We went on a sleepy, hot summer afternoon, but I imagine it must be pretty nice to sit outside on a cooler evening.  We ordered their jalapeno poppers, which were fried jalapenos with a tuna filling and an eel glaze, to begin our meal.  The poppers came out with a dark brown breading, as if old oil had been used in the fry.  The breading itself tasted bland, and the jalapenos were mushy and tasteless.  There was hardly any spice or flavor to the dish outside of the spicy mayo in the filling.  Not too good.  Then came our main course.    I ordered their Vegas, Philadelphia, and Monster rolls.  The Vegas rolls were OK.  They were a bit too soft for my liking (not having a crispy outside), but the actual taste was good.  The Philadelphia rolls were very good in terms of taste and texture, and the appropriately named Monster rolls were also OK.  They were a bit lukewarm, but OK.  That said, the rolls weren't as good as the ones I've had at Shimagomo, Ryu Sushi & Teppanyaki, Sushi San, and Sushiya.  My girlfriend fared worse with her order.  She ordered the Mongolian beef, which came with fried rice, a house salad, and a vegetable roll.  I ended up trying most of her food.  The house salad was actually very good.  Whatever ginger-teriyaki dressing they used was excellent.  The fried rice was just bad...to the point where it shouldn't have been advertised as fried rice.  It looked as if someone had taken steamed rice, thrown it in a pan with onions and eggs, added soy sauce, and called it a day.  Again, the texture was off.  It was too wet, and there was no sesame, garlic, or ginger to at least anchor the rice as something resembling traditional fried rice.  The texture of the Mongolian beef was strange.  It was too soft, to the point that it had the texture of ham.  We couldn't finish it.  She also had peach tea, which turned out to just be tea with peach syrup added.  The waitress who served us was attentive enough to know that something was wrong with the food and ask us about it.  The manager came by shortly thereafter to ask about the food and ended up taking the Mongolian off of the bill.    Overall, not a great experience.  We may try Otaku on another busier night, but it probably won't be soon.

Came here on a Monday night. The location in a half empty business seems a bit strange, and it's easy to miss if you aren't looking for it. However, it's definitely worth a trip!  I'm not hugely adventurous when it comes to sushi, so my friend ordered for us. Was quite good! Will definitely return

*recommending the cheetah roll, moon festival fried ice cream and the orange chicken.   Otaku has great food but even better customer service! My wife, brother and I decided to get Chinese, and let me start by saying we are not big fans of chinese, but my brother was in the mood. The enviorment is very trendy with a circular  window-wall like dining room. Everything we ordered was delicious! (***The cheetah roll with hot cheetos sounds wrong but it taste amazing!). We got a dragon roll were the eel was very salty (just took it off and continued with our chow) but our waitress Stephanie with her great customer service plus making sure that our drinks were constantly topped off made us overlook it.  She was great,  definitely ask for her. Had great knowledge of her food and really made us feel like guest. Even though we didn't complain about it, a passing  waiter,  Stephanie and the manager all would ask us about the eel and if there was anything they could do. It's incredibly refreshing to have this kind of customer service. I will definitely return on the customer service alone (food is a bonus!). In the end the manager decided to give us our orderd dessert free as an apology. Try it out

First time in, we will be back but won't order the same dishes.  Service seemed a little slow and the soy sauce needed to be replaced twice because it was empty.   Sushi was good we will try another time.

Tried this place during Happy Hour... food was okay - nothing special compared to other Sushi places in town.  We thought it was a bit pricey as well for Happy Hour.  Ambiance is nice - inviting!   We may give it another chance soon!

My wife received a gift card to Otaku, so we decided to go at the most awkward time of day for Japanese food....very early Sunday afternoon. First off I'll start by saying Otaku has sooo much potential. Decor, ambiance, and cleanliness were great. We were actually amazed at how cool and modern the inside was. Not sure how long it has been around, but everything looked brand new. Service was great as well. Menu looked packed with a lot of potentially delicious rolls and dishes. We both ordered bento boxes, teriyaki chicken for me and she ordered shrimp. Food was decent, I've had better Japanese....my fried rice was really dry but the rest of my bento box was alright. I'm actually not surprised there are several reviews saying the food was okay, because it was just that. I wouldn't mind going back to try ou their rolls.

I can't believe anyone has rated this place with less than 5 stars. We first went in ~3-4 weeks ago and had Tatum as our server. She found out it was our first time in and spent tons of time with us explaining the menu, answering questions, giving suggestions, etc. The food came out and it was DELICIOUS. Prices were normal for sushi but quality was better than average by far. Came back tonight and had a similar experience, although tonight had several managers stop by to make sure our dining experience was ideal. Tatum even remembered us AND WHAT WE HAD ORDERED weeks ago (more than we even remembered!).  I honestly can't say enough about it - if you go ask to be in Tatum's section.  Wow. Probably the best waitress I've had in years and the food and atmosphere were truly wonderful.

Really like the atmosphere inside. It was very modern and clean. The service was excellent and the waiter was attentive. In general, I would recommend this place to others.   The sushi was slightly above average. The Vegas Roll was par for the course. The Red Blossom was recommended by our waiter, but I didn't love it because I'm not a huge mustard fan--the flavor was a little overwhelming especially for someone who isn't a fan to begin with. Partially my fault for ordering that though. The Dynamite roll was dynamite!   It would be a good place for a date night or to go grab a drink.

I thought they had little selction outside of sushi, it was not the best but not the worst as I didn't have any sushi and the options were limited,  I was also surprised and how few noodle dishes there were. There was only one and it was not the best.

This restaurant has been there for about six years I'm told. I met friends there for dinner tonight and it was fabulous. We sat outside at a table with the fire and everything was delicious.  The inside of the restaurant was also beautiful and everything was so clean.  The Las Vegas rolls were the best!

Great Food, Drinks, Fun Environment, Great Service! My husband and I drive by Otaku all the time and have said we need to go there sometime.  Well we finally dined at there this past Friday night and had a great experience. The sushi was amazing and we tried their Stuffed Jalapenos ~ delicious. Thank you Antonio for offering us dessert that we were just too stuffed to take you up on.  We will be back for dessert, lunch, happy hour and dinner.

Still my all time favorite sushi joint!!!   Doesn't matter how often I eat the sushi, I will still go home and crave some favorite rolls and dishes! ( TIGER & RED BLOSSOM ) !!!! This team has put ALOT of effort and dedication into making this place enjoyable for everyone. The staff and managers genuinely care if their guests are having a satisfying experience! White boys doing the damn thing behind the sushi bar!!! Friendly bartenders :-) and you cant forget the hard work of the cook Charlie in the back, the man behind the scenes who is a genius!  I consider this place a second home.  There is a huge variety on the menu so venture out and try something new because everything is good in its own way!

Came here for lunch a while ago; the mongolian beef bento was good, not great - Ive had better. Although the restaurant possessed a nice atmosphere and seemed pretty clean, the fried rice was bland and tasteless and I've never had such horrible water. Drinks took forever, as did the sushi. The two stars are for the nice interior  and friendliness of our server. Overall, a disappointing and subpar dining experience.

Have had trouble finding good sushi in the area, so I was really happy to find this place. I will definitely be going back. It's a little expensive for dinner, but they do have a good happy hour and you get what you pay for.
Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and delicious food.  The happy hour specials are very affordable.  I would highly recommend Otaku!

Always delicious! Salmon sashimi special is amazing! It's obvious that customer service is their bread and butter. They beat you to the door every time and you will rarely have  to ask for anything, I think they read minds.

I travel all over the state for work and eat sushi frequently. Otaku has Amazing Sushi at very reasonable prices. Incredible staff and customer service! Upscale feel, it is my wife's favorite place for dinner and happy hour.

Where do I start? Our last 2 meals at Otaku were horrendous. The spicy tune handrolls had barely a smidgen of tuna. The fried rice was horrible and had nothing added to it.  The miso soup was flavorless. Plus they forgot the seaweed salads we ordered.   I would suggest that no one ever go there again. I know that I won't.
Sushi was great! Very unique menu choices. Servers and manager were extremely personable. I'll definitely go back!
Great sushi bar, cool ambient vibe with great service. the chopsticks were very luxurious. sit at the bar to get a cool, fun experience. also, their happy hour menu is super affordable. love!

They have a great bento box lunch special with soup or salad, spring roll, dumpling, rice, California roll, and choice of entree. The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. Tip: Ask for the fresh wasabi!
Great service with super yummy food! Love the inside decor as well. Definitely more on the pricey side though. Love this place!

Went here for my birthday dinner, I had the Hot and Messy roll which was $16, this is the most expensive sushi roll I have ever ordered. While it was delicious, including the scallop on top and warm tempura roll, it was not spectacular which is what I was hoping for. My dinner companion ordered the chinese dish of walnut shrimp. The portion was small for the price but it was good, not great for $15. Last week I had a bite of my son's crab roll off the kid's menu, it was pretty good for $2. The adult  prices are  high and you are paying for the ambiance, the decor and layout of the restaurant are gorgeous. Too bad the food is just so-so. Not sure if I will return, I have had better sushi from the Fry's sushi bar for $9 a roll.

Wide variety of sushi, many of them are delicious.  A large selection of Japanese dishes you would not find at a sushi restaurant.  Decent ramen noodles.  If you are going on a Friday evening, expect a wait.  I tried to order takeout on a Friday and was told the order would take over an hour.
Always been good sushi. Good happy hour. Best part you can find dishes for your non-sushi friends.

Wanted to do an update on this place after trying again. I must say the Sushi portions were much bigger than last time and the fried rice was over flowing with meat and shrimp. Not a fan of the loud Techno music they had pumping but maybe Im just old! $7.00 for a Draft Sapporo was WAY too expensive.  Waitress at the bar was fantastic. Blond manager lady was great too...Kinda Angie Dickinson good looking!

Otaku is OK but there are much better and less expensive places to get Sushi.  Stick to Rock Lobster or RA.  I used to love this place and would recommend it to everyone.  Over the last couple of years it has gone down a little.  I usually go here when I have no options.

We've lived in Chandler 7 years and passed this restaurant a thousand times or more but never ventured in due to the word "sushi" in it's name.  Neither of us like sushi.  Well yesterday we went to the Otaku website to check it's menu and were pleasantly surprised to see a lot of Asian fusion items that looked and sounded interesting to both my wife and me.  Fast forward to now, we went to Otaku for dinner tonight and are going back next week for my birthday dinner.  We loved the appetizers (jumbo chicken wings, gyoza, egg rolls and lettuce wraps)...loved our entrees of mongolian beef and Korean BBQ bowl and LOVED the desserts of creme brulee and chocolate lava cake!  Everything we had we would order again.    The food was out of this world delicious and the service from Tyler was super friendly without being over- bearing.  We rank Otaku as one of the top restaurants we've visited since moving here in 2011 and don't plan on passing it up from here on.  5-stars all around!

Chris was great server. Good lunch special for Chinese ($11.00 box lunch with lits of choices) - not as good for sushi (no full rolls on special - just pieces) and unfortunately we went for sushi. Beef & broccoli was very good - sushi was average. Very nice & clean setting. Not the average wood chop sticks - very nice reusable ones.

Had the cheetah roll and my boyfriend had something else, can't remember the name, they were both delicious and the desert is so great. I loved the service as well and excited to come back to try some new rolls
First time here.  Really fresh sushi,  huge variety!  I tried one with Salmon, mango, Asian pear, aspargus...amazing!!!!

I brought some friends here for dinner for their last night out. This is one of our favorite spots so we wanted them to try it for sure. There were a few mishaps along the way, but when I brought them to the managers' attention he went above and beyond to fix the problems and made sure we left extremely happy. Not only will we return for the yummy food,  but we will return for the STELLAR management team and their customer service.

Have been to Otaku a couple times.  Just visited for lunch today.  It was another great meal that myself and my family enjoyed.  The service and the food is fantastic.  Great lunch specials!  Looking forward to going back real soon.

We tried for the first time and were hoping to find a good sushi restaurant close to our new home. This was not it. The sushi was only mediocre, the rice didn't seem soggy and the seaweed had a funny, strong taste. Also the water was terrible and the cups were dirty. I will not be back.

I was really excited to try this place out with my wife.  We both got the Omakase.  Parts of the Omakase meal were good but other parts felt like a lot of sizzle and no steak (i.e. gold flakes left and right).  For the two of us, each with a couple drinks, our bill was in the neighborhood of $200.  Service was fine.    However, my wife and I both developed serious food poisoning that night, which lingered for 24 hours with me.  I eat sushi often and have never had this experience.  Food poisoning happens but what really got my undies in a wad was that I wrote a polite email to the restaurant and never heard a peep back (for the record, I didn't ask for a refund or anything, I just informed them that we developed food poisoning from their food).  In my book, that's just unforgivable.

I went to Otaku on September 7th, 2014 for lunch with my family, and I really enjoyed my experience there. The food there was amazingly exquisit. I ordered the California Roll and it was quickly served, I didn't have to wait at all. The employees there are super kind, they not only made sure everything was to my liking, but they were also very friendly and tried to have a conversation with me. The waiter was extremely attentive, always making sure that I had something to drink throughout my whole meal (which was nice, because lets be honest sometimes wasabi can get really spicy).   The whole restaurant is very clean and welcoming, they have big windows which allows the sun to shine in, without making the restaurant hot. They also have a beautiful fish tank as you walk in allowing you can to see all of the exotic fish swimming around making the experience one to remember. The eatery includes a high ceiling allowing more of an open area feeling rather than claustrophobic and crowded tone. The interior architecture also includes a variety of seating options, diverse plant life and Japanese characters painted on the wall. For an American who hasn't traveled far from home, this wonderful restaurant transported me straight to Japan. I was offered chopsticks and other condiments common with this type of food. The menu had a large majority of food I've never heard of and the waitress was able to describe all the types of fish and textures to provide me with an enjoyable experience. After the meal my family and I were very satisfied with the whole experience and have intentions of visiting Otaku again in the future!

The interior decorating and food was awesome!  Only drawback was the size of the bathroom - not friendly for families as it holds only 1 person!  The garlic edamame was so unique and flavorfull!  I ordered the box lunch which included meso soup, eggroll, fried rice, sushi, and a meat (chicken, steak, etc.) choice.  This was all customizable as well - lots of food for only $9!  What a steal!  Geat job guys!

I really like the food at this place. Lunch bentos are great. Service is weird though. I mean there's just always something wrong or slow. Nothing crazy bad, but ALWAYS something. We go here a lot for company lunches and were joking about the service last time and it seemed flawless until the very end when the server never came back with the tab and we ended up having to go to the bar after waiting for a really long time. Again, nothing that would sway me from going there, but weird.
If your a Cheetos lover then the roll is a must try! Very good lunch portion. Boyfriend couldn't even finish his portion. Yummy place!

Go figure -- worldly sushi in Gilbert?? This place is quickly becoming one of my favorites. Have been here three or four times since it opened.   Susan takes good care of you at the bar, suggesting all kinds of crazy drinks and food and will even arrange to have a staff member give me a foot massage when dining.  Well, haven't asked for the latter.   And I like crazy.  So the escolar, the quail eggs, uni are all up my alley. Same with the exotic "Susan-concocted drinks" like cantaloupe martinis or cucumber martinis made with sake and cucumber vodka. Oh, and have Jay make you a sake shot with a Kumomoto oyster, Uni and quail egg. :)

The lunch Bento Box special can't be beat. My wife took me here for the first time last weekend, and I have already been back this week. The service was fantastic and the food was really good. Finally, a place that has great Mongolian Beef that isn't the price of P.F. Changs. Also, had the orange chicken and it was fantastic. We will be back many more times!!!

This was my first time here. I loved the ambience. It felt modern & classy. I came with my family. Their menu has many choices. We shared the Otaku platter for an appetizer. Everything we ordered tasted wonderful! I had the Galbi- Korean ribs. The only complaint I have is that you get only two pieces of ribs for $14. I feel that it's too pricey for the size. Our server was very accommodating & the manger came to check on our table to make sure everything was ok. All in all our we had an awesome 1st time experience! I definitely recommend it to everyone!!

I am not big into sushi and that's all I've had here but it's really good! The restaurant is very clean and spacious. The bar area and sushi bar have a lot of seating. The outside area have misters which are a must in this heat.   We got spicy garlic edamame and regular edamame because when you check in on Yelp the regular edamame is free!   My favorite roll is the Phoenix tempura. The spicy mayo kind of burned my lips but it was really delicious. I also had the cheetah roll, which has hot Cheetos on top!   Service was excellent. Atmosphere is fun. Food was great. We will be back!

Every time we go we feel like family. Have been going since opened as down the street from us and the food is alway fresh ad good. The sashimi is by far the best freshest every time we go and we have been to others. The edamame are always served hot and taste good as well. The Otaku Fried Rice is one of our favorite must haves when we go as well as the Four Seasons.

I went to Otaku today for lunch with 5 of my girlfriends.  I think the prices were fair for lunch and the food was pretty good, but the service was horrible.  She was slow with very few tables and at times, seemed bothered.  After our food was delivered, she never came back at all, not even for drink or water refills.  I don't want to dis the place as it is a very pretty joint and I would return hoping for a more attentive server.

Great place to grab sushi.  Spicy garlic edamame puts an interesting twist on an old favorite.  I would definitely go this route to start.  Great selection of sushi.  On this trip my wife and I shared the Phoenix tempura, Las Vegas, cheetah, and dynamite roll.  All were good and reasonable priced...especially during happy hour.  Cool trendy decor.  Very clean and consistent good service.  My go to for sushi in the east valley.

Food and service is always fantastic!  Tonight we had an issue with our reservation and the owner Will went above and beyond to make it right!  We will be back to enjoy their food again.  I highly recommend the Tom Yum Hot Pot you will not be disappointed.

I only went here once.  I was going to wait a month or two and try it again before Yelping, but after reading all the reviews I had to speak up. Let me just get this out of the way...soft opening...blah blah blah... OK, now that we've moved past that.  The service is a complete disaster.  It was 20+ minutes, no joke, before we got water and ONE menu to share between the three of us.  After waiting that long for a menu we decided to play it "smart" and just order three appetizers and a beer.  My beer came 15 minutes later.  I ordered another one immediately, I never got the second beer. About 45 minutes after ordering the food came. We asked the girl that brought it what each item was, she said she had to go get our bill (to identify your own apps? really?) and disappeared.  She came back and said she couldn't find our bill and had to find our waitress (good luck!) to ID the apps. Really? The food did NOT make up for the service. Far from it.  The deep fried scallops sucked, could have reheated a box or pre-frozen scallops from the supermarket, thanks.  The rest of the food was uninteresting at best. We told two random girls we had somewhere we needed to be (I'm like 2 damn hours in at this point, the waitress never came to ID the food) and wanted our check.  They said "I can't find it, I have to find your waitress."  20 or so more minutes pass, still no check or waitress, we finally get loud so the waitress comes and asks what we need.  We say "Our check!"  Five minutes later she comes back and comps our meal.   I may not be able to give it a second chance, but other chefs have told me how awesome the head chef is supposed to be.  So I may go back and try the sushi, but it would have to be amazing.  Let me say something here, Otaku is a STRONG word.  I have a shirt that says Super Otaku I bought in Tokyo.  That word means "Nerd".  When applied to food especially, you are making a HUGE commitment.  That only made the experience that much worse.  They should change their name to whatever is Japanese for "Mildly Interested In."
Yummy, orange chicken was good, very clean and professional. Definitely would recommend

So I stopped here on a whim, was riding by saw there sign. Was very pleased by the ambience, we'll decorated felt like I was in an more upscale restaurant then I'm used to, but it had a casual atmosphere. My wife and I split the cha shu ramen ( a pork Ramen with bold flavor), Tom yum hot pot ( chicken and mushroom soup made with coconut milk. Not sweet as i imagined but Balanced nicely with the spices ) and the matador and moon dragon roll both very delicious.

We ordered spicy tuna rolls and had them give us tuna slices instead of the pieces stuff they usually serve.  It was interesting and falls into the "ok" category for me.  Wasn't awesome but wasn't bad, just didn't seem fresh.  I compare pretty much everyone to Smokin Fins so it's a high bar to beat or compete with.  Service initially was slow, but once our waitress arrived she was friendly and helpful.  Probably wouldn't come back, but I wouldn't stay away on purpose like "Osaka Japanese Steakhouse" up the road.
For Arizona this place has really good sushi. I love the unique sushi rolls they offer. I have not seen these at other places and I like that.

Soft-opening, many glitches in the systems as to be expected (they did apologize many times for this), but the food made up for it. The menu is good with great selections.  I especially like the specialty rolls, low carb and all vege rolls.  The list shows some creativity from the chef.  Drinks:  Lychee martini - not bad  Otakuini - Hakutsuru Draft Sake and Cucumber vodka (needs a better sake to mix with this)   Sushi:  Sake (salmon) - good but not great Red Blossom - very good Dragon Roll - very good Friday Night Fever (low carb) - nice low carb roll selection  Monster Roll - big roll with yellow tail, salmon, tuna and tempura - best roll from list  Food:  Hamachi Kama - excellent Grilled Chicken Breast  - with teriyaki sauce and vege's  Overall the food was good, decor is simple and chic, service was slow (soft opening) and the bill was high (even with opening discount).  The food is what is the key element here so I will give four stars.  I will go back for their happy hour when fully open.

We had a 1 star experience celebrating our 15 year anniversary here & instead of feeling special we shouldn't have tried some place new. We were ignored the entire night, including to get our check handled just so we could leave! We will never go back.  If you go here for sushi - just don't... see our review on Temari & go there for 5 star dining.

I really love this place! If you can get there during happy hour, it's even better! They have outside seating which I know is not always the best in Arizona, but I do love their patio, they have music playing but it's not loud and obnoxious like other places can be, and if it is too loud they are very happy to turn it down for you! Their sashimi always tastes so fresh and delicious, and I've yet to have a roll I haven't liked. I highly recommend trying the Cheetah roll! I got it just for sh*ts n' giggles one time, and ended up loving it! Also try ordering fresh wasabi one time, it's very yummy!
Great food. Manager is amazing. Owner was also involved. Good looking staff. This is our new "sushi spot".
One of my favorite sushi restaurants. Consistently good and great service. We are regulars. Highly recommend it.

This is my favorite sushi spot right now. I went in wanting a specific roll that they didn't have but they made it anyways all I had to do was tell them what was in it and they delivered. It's cute inside and the waiters are all nice.

Sushi ok, main courses were extremely salty and luke warm could not eat.  Salad appeared old, lettuce was browning. Waitress was super slow, only 3 customers in place, dirty tables. Too expensive for 3 people, bill was over 115.00. Not again.

Not bad, not great. Hubs and I went for lunch on a Sunday about a month ago. Friendly service, but it took quite awhile to get our food. The sodas were really watered down, which annoyed me. I felt like I should've just ordered water and saved my money. Hubs wasn't too impressed with his food, but I liked mine. I ordered the tootzy roll and the cheetah roll. Both were tasty, although the amount of cream cheese in the cheetah roll was a bit much. Hubs loves to get quail eggs, and this place had them and the presentation was neat. But they're overpriced. Maybe we will go back for dinner sometime, but seeing as we weren't blown away by our first visit, and with it being quite a distance away, it will be awhile before we do.

This place is awkwardly hip and super trendy in a casual part of town. The complex they are in is very new, but with Texas Roadhouse and TGIFs down the road, their location would be more appropriate for Scottsdale and Downtown Tempe or Phoenix.   The prices are what threw my husband, myself, and our two friends array. The rolls don't seem that expensive- but they come in smaller portions, and my husband said the quality was not as high as their prices. Our friends strongly agreed. The price for the Sake Bombs were outrageous, so I didn't get one (I want to say close to $15).   I do not like sushi- I always get non-seafood. Which, their fried rice was delicious, and I enjoyed the potstickers.   I guess I do like the trendy feel, but can't afford it! I loved the cucumber in my water- very refreshing. Our bartender Suzanne was lovely and made us delicious (but pricey!) drinks after our meal.    Overall: good service, but high prices for the quality of sushi.  Would return only if I had a discount or if friends wanted to go.

My husband and is were pleasantly surprised on how great our dinner at Otaku was last night! We have been to this place a couple times before and were not impressed by the service or quality of rolls. However, this time our service was awesome and the sushi were really great! Our server introduced us to fresh wasabi which is SO much better than the green paste! Also try the dynamite roll. Picture attached!  Seems like the place might be under new management. Keep up the good work Otaku!!

I enjoy my sushi, so I was excited to try out Otaku. I liked how they decorated the place, really sharp, cool atmosphere. However, when it came to the the food I was disappointed. Lunch specials are still kind of pricey for what you got ($13) Small rolls, and I would say below than average tasting sushi. Also, it appears servers are still learning the ropes and so service was ok. So nice looking but won't be going back. There are places nearby that have better prices, bigger rolls and mainly just better tasting sushi.

This place is overpriced for the mediocre sushi. The staff was very friendly but the food was just so-so. We ordered our food to go and didn't expect it to be perfect like ordering at the restaurant and that was taken into consideration for this review.   We ordered an appetizer of shrimp tempura, a dragon roll Super-Man roll, a spider roll and a shrimp tempura roll.  Everything was very salty and a lot of the sweet flavor from the rice was lost to the saltiness. We didn't get wasabi in our order either.  I mean come on ... who forgets wasabi at a sushi place?  I've definitely had better sushi in Chandler at better prices.  -------- Updated 5/2017 --------- So I've figured out that this place is much better eating in person. DO NOT ORDER TO GO.  In person though, the sushi was very good and they always give you the wasabi!  The waitress even mentioned that to go orders don't do that well here. They always forget something.  They have a great happy hour menu and has become a nice lunch place for sushi when I don't want to drive across town.
Love this place for food or happy hour. Great staff too! Ladies night every thurs always fun.

I don't know how many times I have driven by this place and never given it thought to stop and try it. Since I moved further out east my original sushi place is now somewhat distant to just stop by so I figured it was time to find another place.   I stopped by on the Chinese New Years. They had a pig prepared and we were able to try it before we left, for free. That was pretty awesome!   I also tried a few of their new/special occasion rolls, which one of them I was absolutely crazy about. As in, I told my server to ensure that he told his management and chefs that they needed to keep it on their menu. I really wish I remembered what they called it. It was different from any other roll ive ever had to teh point where I actually had the flavor seemingly change in my mouth (I've only had food so good that it changed flavor while eating it once before, and that was at the infamous Delmonico Steakhouse in Las Vegas). Effing delicious.  I think I might have to get here more often, even if I can't get anyone to come with me because it is "too far" for them. Crybabies.

This is one of my favorite neighborhood spots but today was definitely a no go for me Sushi rolls tasted less than fresh  Yikes!  There are literally three people here but the service is slow and not very attentive. Better luck next time...i guess. #missmewithtuesdayevening dining experience.

We came here for a late lunch on a Tuesday around 2pm. There were only a couple of tables when we arrived (which sometimes mean you will get poor service) but I was very pleased with the service. The food took a little longer than I would have expected, but not incredibly long. I attributed this to the fact that none of the tables had ordered at the time we arrived so possibly the kitchen had to do some setting up after the lunch rush. But even so, it was not a crazy long wait and still a 5 star review.  The food was good - I had udon noodle soup, an appetizer and tried a couple of the rolls. I really like the variety of unique rolls that are on their menu and would have liked to have tried more but I was craving the soup!   Service was really friendly... Very attentive... The server brought me a new tea before mine was empty each time I needed a refill (I was really thirsty apparently).   Their prices aren't outrageous; I think our total was around $55 for lunch for two people (2 rolls, appetizer, seafood udon soup, 2 beers and a drink). Not bad at all - I would definitely recommend stopping by!

I felt compelled to write a review because I don't want anyone else who loves sushi to suffer the same disappointment as I did yesterday.  The albacore I ordered was dry, not fresh, and packed with a ridiculous amount of rice...basically ruined Japanese food.  It got worse, but I'll just say that if you know a good sushi spot go there because this is never gonna compare.  Seriously bad.

For this being the first time I have ever had sushi, Otaku was a perfect place to go. The service was impeccable. The staff waited on me like I was the only customer in the restaurant. They always made sure my drink was full and took my order politely. They brought me anything I asked for immediately. Not only was the service impeccable, the environment made my experience even better.  As soon as I walked in someone greeted me and seated me at a table. The restaurant has a glass window where you can watch the sushi being made. The ambiance of the restaurant makes the customer feel like they are in Japan eating at a restaurant. The waiters and waitresses are even dressed up in Japanese clothing. Everything from the menus, to the plates, to the walls gives you a sense of the Japanese culture. The food I ordered came out quickly.  The food was delicious. Every roll was made with care and came out perfectly. The serving sizes they offer are incredible for the prices. The California roll was delicious. It was wrapped in seaweed and rice and it was filled with cucumber, crab meat and avocado. To have the roll taste perfectly, I dipped it in soy sauce which I mixed with wasabi. This added extra flavor to the roll. Another roll that blew my mind was the Spicy Tuna roll. The Spicy Tuna roll contained spicy tuna, Japanese cucumbers, sushi rice, and Nori. This roll should also be dipped in wasabi and soy sauce. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking to have a nice meal, great service, and an authentic environment.

I came for lunch with my baby and the waitress seemed to remember us. That was sweet! The sushi was so fresh. I've been to many sushi places around the valley and I've had very delicious sushi and quite questionable sushi. The fish at Otaku had no fishy smell or flavor, was firm, cold, and seemed very fresh. I ordered the sushi and sashimi lunch and it came out very quick. I will surely return!

Good overall sushi place.  Decor is nice and contemporary and their selection for sushi rolls was nice. One standout was the Cheetah roll (cant beat flaming hot cheetos). Presentation of food was nice. I don't remember the rest of the items i ate so that is why its not getting a higher rating. I only tried the Sushi type items not sure about the rest of the menu.  Not a bad place to check out.  Portions are not as big as other places and prices are ok to slightly above average
Beef Chow Fun is awesome every time! Food is fresh and portions are perfect. Hubby loves the sushi!

I live right down the street so my family comes once every 6-8 weeks. It is close by and convenient. To be honest the food isn't great but it is decent. We like to sit outside so our 6 year olds can be kids and not bother anyone.  Server Savannah the Irish gal is a doll, very friendly. My kids love the honey chicken. We always order is the cheeto roll. The drinks are ok, I order the lemon drop which is pretty consistent.  I wouldn't drive a distance to visit here but it's nice to come here on a Friday after a long week.

Went here tonight for a birthday. Absolutely awesome food, decent prices and great ambience. Tastefully decorated with a busy  bar, and a sushi bar. We sat at a table. Sushi was great. I ordered the sweet and sour chicken which was enough for 2 people but the rice portion was small so we had to ask for more. Not bad for $10. The hot and sour soup was delicious and came in a huge bowl, enough for 3 or 4 people and that was $6. My only complaint was the establishment was a little warm inside. I am usually cold so it was noticeably warm and several members of my party thought so too. It was 110 out...crank up that A/C! Other than that, we enjoyed ourselves and I will come back.

We just had a mediocre lunch here. What made it bad was mostly the service. Not sure if they were understaffed but it really wasn't that busy. It started out bad when we had to wait about 5 to 10 minutes just to be seated for lunch. There was nobody in front of us, nobody behind us, and nobody to even acknowledge our existence.   When someone finally said that he would be right there to seat us we thought he would finish up what he was doing and come seat us. Wrong, he proceeded to clear more tables and more tables before someone else had to come seat us. To me, that is not a good idea to keep customers waiting when you could do that after we sat down. It wasn't like they were busy or needed the tables. Just bad prioritizing.   The wait for our food was terribly long. The food was mediocre. We also had to wait quite awhile for our check. We hardly saw our waiter during our meal.  I think this place needs to work on customer service more before they continue to lose customers. I'm willing to give the place another try just in case it was a bad day and hope things are different.  The restaurant does look nice and has some potential.

Stopped in for dinner on Saturday, party of 3 hungry adults. We were greeted and seated quickly. Our server (Luke) was very friendly and attentive. We started with the appetizer platter we selected bacon wrapped shrimp, calamari, chicken wings and angel puffs.. everything was delicious.. however, the wings kind of tasted reheated. The sweet chili sauce was awesome as was the sweet n sour sauce.  We had to have some sake with our meal and the strawberry sake came highly recommended...and did not disappoint!  We then added the main events... SUSHI!! The Las Vegas, The Dragon, The Cheetah, The Mardi Gras, The tootzy and the Phoenix rolls were absolutely amazing!! My personal favorite was the Mardi Gras roll.. it was very refreshing and flavorful, though, all of these rolls were delicious and I would order them all again.  Dessert... yep we made room for dessert.  The cheesecake roll, chocolate mousse and creme br√ªl√©e arrived and vanished just as soon as they landed on our table.  We walked out very satisfied!  Thumbs up OTAKU!
The service......amazing! The food...........mediocre. The atmosphere....beautiful! 1-10 scale i would give it a 6 mainly because of the awesome service.
They want to be cool but they just come off as the kid trying too hard. It's crazy overpriced  and the food was not fresh. Oysters was 3 $ each and they were tiny.

We came here for the first time today and had a great time.  Sat outside with the misters on and were not rushed out during our leisurely lunch.  Service was good and friendly and they even welcomed our well behaved puppy on the patio.  The salmon sushi and sashimi were VERY good although portions were small. The quality of fish is above average so I can deal with the smaller portions so long as they keep the fresh fish coming. Loved the spicy tuna roll and Monster roll too. Overall we really enjoyed this place and loved that it was pet friendly.  Next time we are in the area this will be a must go to place.

This is my go to sushi restaurant! Great service, great vibe, great sushi! I've been going there for years and it's always been consistently well! Everything is so delicious and everyone is so nice!! I recommend this place to everyone. Plus, they serve other tasty food besides sushi, which is great for my brother and dad who aren't sushi-eaters.

Fire in the mouth roll was delicious, and I'm not even a big sushi lover... My wife had that plus the miso soup... Both were very good... Contrary to some other idiots post, the rolls are normal size rolls, not small at all. Since I'm not a sushi lover, I got sweet and sour chicken... I asked for it to be spicy, but it didn't come out that way, but the staff apologized and brought out some chilly paste. Food was hot and delicious. My one real complaint is the hot green tea... There's no kind of filter so when you pour the tea you get lots of flotties in your cup... However, you can minimize this by using the lid to cover most of the spout... All in all, very good place. Definitely plan on coming back.  Oh, staff is very prompt and friendly... Give it a try and I think you'll like it

I have eaten here several times and each time, the staff is pleasant,  Sushi is fresh and comes out very quickly and, the place is CLEAN! They have a decent children's menu as well! I recommend this place if you're looking for your new place  to chow down some Sushi with friends or take a date and enjoy some fun cocktails ;)

Chris, our wonderful server, took the time to try to get an outdoor heater to work for us. Seeing that our heater initially did not have a propane tank, he worked diligently - the first tank was empty; without a word, he went and grabbed a SECOND propane tank. Instead of just giving up, he worked hard with no complaints - he even apologized for the initial propane tank! It's obviously not his fault, so it just goes to show the top notch customer service all done with a smile. His customer service will definitely be bringing us back.   P.S. try the Vegas roll, it's absolutely delicious!

Been here several times and the sushi and service has always been good. Came today, and the appetizers were great, the service was great, but the sushi was horrible for some reason. We should have said something as soon as it came, but waited until we were leaving to mention it. Waitress was very nice and apologized, but not sure what happened with the sushi today. Will definitely try them again, but the sushi literally tasted like dirty dish rag. Maybe it was the plates or something else, but just not good today :(.

I love this restaurant!!! We, unfortunately, missed their grand opening but we finally made it there last night and after such a positive experience, we are sure to be regulars!  First of all, this is a gorgeous restaurant! It is obvious that a lot of love and planning went into the design and decor. Everything is warm and inviting; very upscale but not snooty! Most will be very comfortable here.  The food was uniformly excellent! We only tried one non-sushi item, the scallop poppers, but that dish was amazing!!! Very generous portions and very tasty with a terrific sauce! Based on this experience, we will have to try more menu items next time! We tried several of their specialty rolls and they were all outstanding. My favorite was simply called "The Roll" but there are many others that I plan on sampling in the coming weeks (like I said, we will be regulars!). I was surprised that we loved some of their low carb rolls as well. These rolls substitute the sushi rice with a rice paper wrap which I found, allowed the other ingredients to delight your taste buds even more! Between the traditional, specialty and low carb rolls, there is a lot of creativity going on here by Chef/Owner Jay Chung!!!  I would say that the service was excellent as well. It was not overly busy but it was busy enough. We were never left wondering where our waiter was and our sushi chef, David (The Hongster), was very attentive! Everyone was very friendly and by the end of our meal, we felt like family! We were treated to several complimentary sample rolls, all of which were delicious and we will probably order those next time. This was such a nice touch and makes for a loyal customer.  All in all, I don't think you can go wrong dinning here. The food was excellent, the staff friendly and attentive and the chef/owner was very creative and friendly! I think Otaku is very unique for Gilbert and a welcomed dinning experience for the east valley! The only bad thing is that it is a 25 minute drive from our house... Maybe we should move?

I absolutely love this place.  Happy Hour menu is awesome.  I love tuna tartare.  Great martinis!!  Service is excellent.  My son loves the staff here, they always come and say hi to him.  I would recommend to any of my friends, family.
Drinks AWESOME! They have escolar which is the best shashimi and not all Sushi places offer. Love it!

Best sushi we've had south of 202 in Maricopa county. Flavor in all rolls we had were really delicious. Lots of different sauces and individually unique. Oyster shooters were really good. We like a little more vinegar in ours but this was def. Best we've had in east valley so far. Service quick, nicely decorated, great waitress, we'll be back to try more. :)

The wifey and I came here on a Saturday Valentine's Day night.  Parking was easy since it's in a plaza.  We had reservations booked online so we were not worried about waiting for a seat.  It was already busy as they have a bar and outdoor patio that was popping.  Everything was very new and in great condition.  Their sushi and teriyaki dish was good.  Lots of chicken in the teriyaki.  At the end of the meal, we were greeted by the owner and she was very elegant.  She gave my wife a complementary single rose for the occasion.  Awesome!  This is a lively Japanese/Chinese fusion restaurant/bar in Chandler that has to be tried.

Great sashimi and sushi. They have other good options for your non-sushi eaters. I like the szechuan scallops and shrimp. They have a fun environment. We like tonsit on the patio. Try their tempura cheesecake, too! Yummy!
Great food and good service as well. Happy hour daily from 3-6! Definitely put it on your sushi list.  Recently tried additional items and will be sticking with the Sushi only...

The restaurant was beautiful and the food was delicious,  our waitress was super sweet . Me and my husband went to this restaurant for the first time on Saturday night for date night. Everything appeared great...until late Saturday night my husband got sick and early Sunday morning so did I. I am still sick today ...the kind of sick which is consistent with food poisoning and the only meal we ate together that day was at this restaurant. We will not be returning.

Just recently went to Otaku for mother's day lunch. It was relatively quiet in the restaurant for it being mothers day. It's location is somewhat hard to see from the street, so that could possibly be a reason why. The service was kind, the doors were open so some bugs flew in and out. The food was on time, and good. They had a pretty standard sushi menu, the tuna nigiri sushi was  was one of my favorites. I would return another time after a little break due to the mid-tier sushi prices.

First time here and a wonderful dining experience.  The staff was warm and welcoming. Server was very attentive.  Food was absolutely delicious.  The only downside was that it was a bit too loud, but we will definitely be back!

This place has really gone down hill. We used to come for bento boxes during lunch, but today's experience was not enjoyable. While the atmosphere is posh and the staff is attentive, my coworkers and I were pretty disappointed in the food and the pricing. A lunch bento box is now $13. And the sushi rolls are tiny. I got a $8 seaweed salad that was really more of a wild greens salad with seaweed sprinkled on top. I will say you get good portion of food with the bento box, but with sushi places littering Gilbert Rd you have so many other options.  With lunch pricing like that, attention to details needs to be taken more seriously. That being said, our table cloth was pretty filthy-- with old sauces slashed (wiped up) and dried up on it. My coworker had a fly in her side sauce and had to send it back. And another coworker's glass was so beat up it looked like it had rolled in the street a few times.  My coworkers wished we'd had gone a half mile north to Osaka after today's experience. That place was a good time! And two miles north of that is Sushiya-- you get a lot of food for your money there. Otaku is a posh place with food that doesn't live up to its image.

Happy Hour Prices and selection are not all that...Food is good, and the sushi is fresh. Actually the food and the service is on point....the happy hour is what brings down the rating.   Get your shit together!!!

Been here a couple of times.  Nothing bad to say.  Food is great.  Can't give 5 stars, because I am a noobie to the Sushi world and I don't want to speak for those who are experts.  Can say that for someone like myself it was great.  Staff is friendly and very helpful.  Place is kind of in a weird location, but worth the visit.

If you like spicy, ask them to make a Kill Bill roll for you (it's not on the menu)...  Spicy tuna roll, topped with unagi, sweet eel sauce, thinly sliced jalape√±os and, last but not least, Thai chilies!  Dip in a little soy sauce and you'll have spiciness, sweetness and saltiness all together in each bite. Yummy!

we came in and were immediately seated, albeit a bit awkwardly. Maybe it was our clothing and appearance, we looked pretty ruffled but we were ravished. The menus were provided and we ordered immediately. i got the chrirashi and my boyfriend got the crunchy california roll. He said the roll was good and the price wasnt outrageous.   As for me, the fish in the chrirashi was not as fresh as i had hoped and the rice didnt seem to be traditional japanese rice but rather was bland and unappetizing. and i reluctantly ate most of it.   lastly a note on the wasabi, their wasabi was just... not good.   3 stars for excellent service and a beautiful setting and the crunchy california roll. -2 for the chrirashi bowl. i could be wrong, this is just my opinion based on several sushi places we've been to in the area.
Went for the first time and I probably won't be going back. The sushi tasted like store bought sushi from a carton. This does not even compare to Kona grill.

Spicy jumbo chicken wings were very good. Ordered the tri tuna lunch. Nice cuts, fresh and good mix. Received the free edamame with check in. The beans were cooked right- not soft and mushy like some places- with sea salt. The service was great. The other people with me ordered the sashimi and sushi lunch. They enjoyed it too.

Been wanting to try this restaurant for awhile now and was so excited when I saw a livingsocial deal I just had to have it. The food was good but our server was not so great. It took her long periods of times to bring back drinks and such. We asked for a childrens menu when we sat down and it took 34 minutes for her to come back empty handed and we had to ask her again. They only thing I could say about the food was I wish they would bring the dishes out all together instead of staggered apart.

After reading the reviews for Otaku I wasn't sure if I was headed to the best or worst sushi restaurant.  The reviews seemed to be polar opposites.  The interior of the restaurant is beautiful.  High ceilings, stone tile floors, and marble table tops.  The seats were modern Asian, but very comfortable.  There are ceiling to floor windows and outdoor seating.  There is a large saltwater aquarium in the entrance with puffer fish, lion fish, hippo tangs, etc.  The restaurant was not very busy during the lunch hour.  Only a handful if tables were occupied.  I was sat quickly and my server was attentive at firsyt, but after my meal was delivered I didn't see him again until the check came.  I ordered the Fire in the Mouth roll upon his suggestion.  I also order a Bento box with crispy walnut shrimp.  The roll took much longer then I expected.  I ordered the roll first thinking I could start my meal with it.  I'm not sure what took so long, after all they aren't really cooking anything.  The roll and salad from the Bento box came out at the same time.  The salad was good with sesame dressing (although I would have preferred a creamy ginger).  The salad could have been dressed better.  Most of the dressing was on the bottom of the bowl.  The roll was okay.  It was served on a pretty plate, but was not plated well.  The sauce was just half hazzardly spooned over the roll.  The roll was a little spicy, but other then the spiciness of the jalapeno and sauce there wasn't much depth of flavor.  The rice was a hair undercooked (or dried out) in my opinion.  Definitely not my favorite roll.  The Bento box looked nice.  The Walnut shrimp were great.  Large shrimp with a great sweet white sauce  The California roll was okay (once again the rice is either undercooked or dried out).  The gyoza and egg roll were both cooked perfectly and were pretty large.  They both tasted good.  The fried rice was tasteless with an occasional chunk of egg.  Overall I was not overly impressed with my meal.  It is possible that the other things on their menu are great, but since I don't live in the area I will probably no be back.  Side Note:. A few of the tables around were picking up their sushi roll pieces with their hands.  Not just a piece or two.  They ate their whole meal that way.  I have seen people eat nigiri that way, but never maki (except for an occasional end piece).  Is that an Arizona thing?
The red blossom is the best! And the grapefruit martini superb! The service is amazing! One of my favorite sushi places

Took my 7 year old here to have her first sushi bar experience. The restaurant was completely empty, but we came right at 1130 on a Saturday.  I couldnt convince her to try the sushi but she did get a bowl of sushi rice($2.50) and she loved the Mochi ice cream sundae ($2). After looking at the menu and coming down from the sticker shock ($23 for a Poke bowl seemed a little steep and I am the person who always orders the chirashi bowl at every sushi bar!), I opted for a salmon hand roll ($7) and masago sushi (2 pcs, $6). The masago had generous portion of eggs, and they were delicious. The salmon in the hand roll was super fresh and delicious, but I was a bit dissapointed the the hand roll as it only had rice and salmon wrapped in nori. Usually hand rolls have cucumber, avocado, raddish sprouts or other fun things to make them exciting. It also wasn't very big, which tends to be why people order hand rolls...  This had none which left me a bit disapointed. We also sat at the bar because I wanted the kiddo to get to watch them making the sushi but the bar was solid and too high for her to see the process. Overall the quality of the food was excellent, and we will definitely be back but will get a seat by the aquarium. And definitely more of a special ocasion vs everyday meal type place.

I went here last Friday and it was one of the best sushi I've had so far in Chandler. Soft opening right now, but after they get their kinks all fixed I'm sure it's going to get even better. Service was ok, but the food was outstanding and the ambiance of restaurant is like no other in the area.

I'm seriously in love with Otaku. I crave this place, frequently. As evidence of my love for this place, in their first 3 months of opening I went there about 10 times, and I live 30 miles away. Perhaps "obsessed" is a better term here.  In addition to the above, I actually followed the sushi chef, Jay Chung, from his previous sushi joint. Turns out, this place was basically built for him, and for good reason! Better sushi is hard to come by, especially in the Phoenix metro!  My favorite option here is sitting at the sushi bar and ordering "omakase," or "chef's choice." Essentially, you just sit down and let the chefs get creative. They'll feed you anything and everything. I have yet to be disappointed with this option, and I am constantly wowed with what they create. The rolls are delicious and many are quite unique, with a great balance of rice, fish and filling. My poison, however, is sashimi. I would kill for a nice slice of tasty, fresh, raw fish. And Otaku does not fail here. In fact, they get some of the freshest sashimi I have ever had; it's truly impressive.  So if you go here, don't just have a california roll or something equally dull. Be brave, try something new, ask for recommendations, or just let the chefs feed you -- you will not be disappointed!

Food is great. Although the location is a little bit off the beaten path it makes for a nice, quiet dinner. The sushi is authentic and they have Chinese food for those not fond of sushi. The cheetah roll is by far my favorite.. Even though it is a little gimmicky with the flaming hot Cheetos in the center, it tastes amazing!
The staff was friendly, we were seated right away. The atmosphere was perfect for a date night. The drinks were well mixed and the sushi was great. I will definitely be returning.
Not a good experience. The service is very slow. The sushi tastes like it's about to turn bad.  We keep giving this place a chance because it is close to home. Every time we go we are disappointed.

Came for dinner on a Friday night with My family. Great service, good vibe, tasty food...  Would definitely come back again. Our sever, Stephanie was spectacular. She was on point with all of her recommendations of what we preference we had and detailed about all the dished they had to offered. She came to check on us several times even after our dishes was brought out to see how we liked it... Outstanding customer service from my point of view. Overall it's great.
