Great lunch options. The orange chicken is amazing. Definitely not you Panda Express quality. It's perfectly crispy with a bit of zing. The chirashi bowl tasted fresh and lovely with chopped cucumber and avocado.

Great friendly staff. Food is pretty good. Only took one star off just because they kept forgetting to get us small items like plates, silverware, sauces. Not a deal breaker of any sort. I'll come back here again.

We came on a livingsocial. The place looks great. Looks hi quality. Looks like the food would be good. However, that's where it stops. We had 4 types of sushi. All were very average. All very small. The rainbow roll was again average, as well as the rest. Basically a nice place with avg service and nice looks, avg food at a very very overpriced bill ! Will not be back.

I can't say I was very impressed with the service at the bar. The table service may be good. Patrons seemed like they were having a GREAT time. So don't get me wrong, this was just at the bar. A dirty martini has brine, hence the dirty... he called it "dirty juice" I'm not sure he knew what brine was. We had to repeat our order to him multiple times.   The orders weren't made to description. Food items weren't put in correctly or brought out at all. He tried redeeming himself but his poor attitude didn't help. He got better as the night went on but it was pretty much an overall failure. Paying more attention to his possible regular guests while neglecting and providing service to new guests.   I'm in the process of moving back to the valley on a different side of town. I see no reason to return to this establishment.   Also, I noticed a patron trying to order an old fashion. I cringed when I heard him. If this guy couldn't make a dirty martini how is he going to make an old fashion? Luckily, the man asked him how he made it. When I heard how he made it I knew for sure the man would turn it down ---and he did, rightfully so!
Had my birthday dinner here and it was perfect. We enjoyed the Hot Cheetos roll for the first time and our normal sushi order. Everything turned out great and service was on point.

This place is really good for a date. Cocktails were very strong which I like! You have to try the cheetah roll. I'm not a sushi purist so in love the experimentation! Actually okay to go on weekends too because it isn't bursting at the seams with people. We sat at the sushi bar the first time and a table the second time and the service was good. Definitely coming back.

This place seems to still be going though some growing pains. Ambience is ok, tables are oddly laid out and it seems they could use some of the space better and fit a few more tables in.  Most of the food I've ordered has been good but it seems some of the recipes have changed. The hot and sour soup used to have more 'kick' to it, it is still very good but I prefer it very hot tasting. The sweet and sour chicken seemed a little dry and next time I will ask for more sauce. Our friend ordered the orange chicken and it was very good. Service is touch and go, seems we had to hunt our server down a couple of times and ask for more napkins and silverware. I honestly have never had much of their sushi, except for the squid salad, which was a huge serving and tasted ok. Drink menu is average, only thing that stood out was the 'pomtini'.. no prices on the drink menu either. For $8 the pomtini was average, didn't even some with a sugared rim or any fruit. There is room for improvement for almost everything here and hopefully it can only get better.
Been here 3 times, so far everything's been good.  I'm not giving it 5 stars because I think it's a little pricey.  Good food though, great atmosphere, great service.

Actually should be 2 1/2 stars . The reason I'm giving it this many stars is because the garlic at a mommy ate was a rocking good the lettuce wraps are probably the worst I've ever had flavorless and greasy the reason  get them is because I want to eat healthier/lighter. It's a big nice place but the benches are ripped up. Staff is really nice.

My coworkers & I frequent this spot for lunch, they have really great lunch specials! Their bento boxes are only $11 & the super generous portions could easily be shared with a friend.   Last week we had a little "incident" with something ending up on the plate that shouldn't have been there. The manager's reaction absolutely blew me away. Most restaurants will give you an insincere "I'm sorry," but she went above & beyond to correct the mistake. Customer service at its finest!   The 4 star rating is only because of the slowness of the waitstaff. Lunch for most professionals is on a time schedule, and the waitstaff needs to accommodate that & pick up the pace!

Let's start with the service, fantastic. They're very nice and attentive, but never invasive or bothersome. They have lunch specials which makes it nice, but I had the spring jalapeno chicken and it was delicious. Just the right amount of fire, and all the flavor you could hope for.   While the ambiance is a bit quiet, they have tv's running, and the look is very clean and modern. It is by no means a boring place. I can only image how epic this place would be like on a Friday night, maybe Happy Hour?

Finally a decent sushi restaurant near home! I went to their soft opening for dinner and as soon as I walked in I was actually pretty surprised on how nice & big it was, the decor, fine dinnerware, the whole setting. Whoever designed the place did a pretty good job. And I like how the bar is in the middle of the room and there are sections of places you could sit around the place. I noticed how some of the waitresses were wearing their fake Gucci pouches and staff members were using ipads. It seemed like a fancy sushi restaurant. I was just hoping it wasn't another one of those RA/Roka Akor like sushi restaurants. Their sushi is horrible!   Anyways got seated by some waitress and she freaken took forever to get our drinks, then moments later she came back with our appetizer which was the Otaku spicy tostada. This was good!!!! She even suggested to try their kitchen food instead of sushi so we did and I got the seafood tofu hotpot & boyfriend got the curry chicken. The curry was rather watery kinda like curry soup which was eh.The seafood hotpot on the other hand was actually pretty good with lots of flavor. Mine didn't come with rice so I was waiting on our waitress, but she was seriously missing the entire night! Thankfully my friend actually works there and she came to check up on us & I told her I needed rice she was brought it for me. Even one of the manager came over to our table and asked us how our food was. Overall, I had a good time, most of the staff was pretty friendly.  I understand that during that time since it was their soft opening some things were a bit unorganized but still the our waitress sucked. My friend even had to go look for her in the kitchen to let her know we were done and was ready for our check! GRR  I also went here for happy hour just yesterday and it seemed to be a bit more organized & in place. YAYYYY! =P Tried their tootzy roll, spicy tuna, & vege roll. It wasn't GREAT, but it was good. And service was good too. I say their kitchen food is probably a bit better than their sushi. But overall I like this place definitely would go back again.

Always a family favorite!  I have neglected to write a review until today...just lazy on my part.  Hot-n-messy was my first today and worth the $16.   Singapore style rice noodles are great.  Squid salad is a must to start with.  Zack the manager can help you if you need advice...as wi any of the great staff.  We will be back again and again and again...

Really great place.  Live nearby and never knew they were there until I looked on Yelp.  Finally, good sushi in the east east valley near Power Ranch.  Been here twice, once at the bar and once at a table.  Solid service, clean and very good food.  Have tried cocktails, sake by the bottle and lots of sashimi.  The 24 piece sashimi plate is the best deal on the menu.  Get over you're fear of raw fish.  It's light, tasty and a fun experience.  The real wasabi is an interesting feature and hard to find anywhere.  A little tiny dollop of that on nigiri or sashimi and you're good.  Tried the fried rice, snow crab California roll and miso soup too.  Everything was fresh and fantastic.  Can't wait to go back.

We love this place.  Came here with my wife and little guy.  The waitress we had was super friendly with him and very attentive. They have some cool sushi renditions here for rolls.  The Korean short rib is hands down one of the most amazing things I've ever eaten.  Get it you'll love it.  The decor is pretty interesting and the place was jamming with people when we got there so it has a nice atmosphere.  They messed up our roll immediately came over apologized fixed it and comped us a tempura fried cheesecake.   Let me tell you the cheesecake is unbelievable.  It melts in your mouth when you eat it.   The manager was great and quick to fix and please.  They won us over as return customers.

Nice atmosphere and music.  Definitely more of an adult setting in my opinion.  A very nice place to meet up with friends and talk over beer and wine.  The food is good, it's not mind blowing, but what I've tried so far is pretty good.  The service is good as well, the hostesses and waiters are helpful and considerate of time frames.  I didn't have to wait forever for a drink refill, as in some places can be the case.  The staff is mostly smiling and kind, a definite plus in my eyes.  The place was clean and presentable, though I didn't use the bathroom, so not sure about that.  The minus star is that the food is just good, not great.  But, personally I am the type of person who goes to places for the overall experience, and I would definitely return to this place!  4 stars.
First time here. I managed a sushi restaurant up in north scottsdale, so i know sushi. And this place is my new favorite. Will definitely become a regular here!

So, I am not easily impressed, but always willing to give a new sushi place a shot, so naturally had to try this place out. We stopped in on a busy Friday night at happy hour and except for a sad looking fish tank at the entrance, the restaurant is beautiful. Someone spent bank on this place and it shows.   We were sat at the sushi bar, at our request and glad we did as we got to see the sushi chefs in action. Although the chefs were busy, you got the impression they were in control and did not rush so much to make sloppy sushi rolls.   We ordered a squid salad, order of goyzas, a shrimp tempura roll and a spicy tuna roll. All were excellent and I was most impressed that the spicy tuna roll had more tuna than rice, all tasted fresh and delicious.   The only glitch of the night was when we were told their credit card system was having a problem and they apologized for the delay. It was not a problem for us as we were still finishing up our drinks. After a few minutes our server came out and advised he was taking $15 off our bill for the delay. I thought it was a nice, but unnecessary gesture until I checked my account and found they charged not only my dinner but apparently some other diners dinner as well. I am guessing the mistake has been corrected but I will not know for sure until all the charges from the weekend clear. I suppose would have been happier if they had have just been honest with me and gave me a heads up what happened, but in the end I suppose its not the end of the world as mistakes do happen.   Despite the billing error I definitely look forward to returning.
Loved it. Great service.   I loved the ambiance of the restaurant as well.

This is our new sushi spot; having moved from Portland, OR we're used to fresh seafood. Otaku did not disappoint! They get fresh shipments in every two days! Our server Tyler was VERY attentive, knowledgeable, and helpful. The food was delicious, with high quality ingredients. My family's favorite was the Cheetah roll, but everything was great! We can't wait to come back!
Amazing location n food. Order the cheetah roll. It's great!! Enjoyed a great conversation with the manager. Also ask for the fresh wasabi, it's super spicy n yummy

Great interior design and wonderful sushi. I would rate the service at a 3 stars mainly because I had to get up and get plates for our appetizer, and that was after I asked a hostess who said she would get them right away. Then I watched her talking with other staff as if there were nothing better to do. So I went to the bar where another employee apologized for the miss. When we received our sushi, we again had to ask for plates and then we received wet ones. I don't think this type of service is what the owner/s expect for their customers, so I hope they and or their manager's focus on how they serve customers so we come back. We'll give it another try, though we may just sit at the counter near the chef instead of at a table.

Bang for the Buck: 3.5/5 - Pretty pricy overall, not much on the happy hour menu but there were some nice items there that I normally don't get but will as I go back. - This rating may change as I go back there more, we will see  Decor: 3/5  - would get another star but the salt water fish tank was almost 100% empty. 4 small fish, 100gal+ tank. The rest of the place was nicely done. - a bit hipster/trendy but that was fine. I like the rotunda area and the patios... need more patios IMO.  Ambiance: 3/5 - nothing special, the normal large open room style that I hate when places are busy. They are fine if they are not busy  Service: 2/5 - needs improvement, and the place was ~15% full. - the manager was great, super nice guy. but took him 20 minutes to get some rice we asked for. Took our actual server about 15 minutes. - several of our dishes went to the table next to us... on several different occasions. - food was very slow to come out... VERY slow and very spaced out. Not a good pace to the meal, a bit frustrating  Food Quality: 5/5 - I had no issues here. We tried several items and they were all very good quality  Food Quantity: 3/5 - this was a bit of a mixed bag. - seaweed salad was perfect (and delicious). The baby calamari was a very small portion, the tempura was alsot perfect. The sashimi and sushi rolls were a good portion size - this rating may change as I go back to try other things.  Food Flavor: 4.5/5 - everything was perfect except the baby calamari... which was greasy and overcooked.  Food Uniqueness & Creativity: 3.5/5 - the rolls were fairly creative, nothing I have not seen before but above average... thus the 3.5 rating here. This may change as I try other things too.  Last Experience... 03/17/2011  Seaweed salad - very very good, will be getting this a lot Green tea - loose leaf and brewed in pot, perfect touch. Tea was average green tea but WAY better than pre-bagged! Sushi Rolls - we had several and they were all very tasty, and decent size. Tempura mix was very good - not greasy, good portion, etc. Will have this often.

Really tasty and fresh sushi!  We tried it out and have been there twice already, once for happy hour.  The fish is fresh and the flavors are great!  Would have given it 5 stars except for the price is a little higher than I like to pay for sushi.  The happy hour prices and options could be a little better, but overall it's definitely worth the money if you are looking for a nice bite of sushi!

Enjoyed our meal.  Very kid friendly. Order the cougar roll, very refreshing. The cheesecake dessert is CLEVER.  I've had better cheesecake but the presentation made us smile. Service was pleasant and not intrusive.  Thanks for that. Turn down the music.  Shrink the table size.  Make your rice more consistent.
Fantastic.  Service can be hit or miss but the food makes up for it.

I came here because I saw pictures of sushi on the Yelp app that made my mouth water.  Unfortunately, I didn't get any of those pieces but what I had was okay.  The quail eggs were delicious.    The bartender here is phenomenal!  Cute little Asian packed with personality. She made me promise to come every Thursday for ladies night.  If you're a female in the area on a Thursday, go there!  She will take care of you!
First of all I must say that their customer service is excellent! I'm a big fan of the walnut shrimp.Everything about Otaku is on point.

Havent tried the sushi selection yet, but the tom yum hot pot was delicious & the Singapore style rice noodles went great with it. They have a small selection of alcoholic beverages, my all time favorite is the Moscow mule.  Bento box for kids that may not like sushi, but the Asian fusion is a wonderful combination if you cant make up your mind.

Kinda far from civilization, but it's all good.  Gotta eat inside the tree room!  The room is amazing - according to the waiters and one of the owner, everything was imported from oversees.  I didn't order sushi, but I did get the Hong Kong style noodles and Seafood Tofu Soup -- Mmm, yes both times hit the spot.  Aromatic and tasting at the same time -- what's not to like!  Our service was outstanding, small or a large crowd is not a problem.  Will save this place in my pocket for next time :) (Shout-out to Jay, Shane, & Stephanie!) - Enjoy

I loved this place, have driven by it several times and decided to stop in on a Saturday night, I was surprised it was not more crowded but that was good for us.   Our service was exceptional, greeted by a very friendly host, sat us in a nice booth....the restaurant is beautiful inside. Our server was prompt and friendly, and the other servers were also attentive to us when needed.  The food was great, we shared three rolls and the seaweed salad. We had the Moon dragon, The Lollipop and the Hot n Messy....  this place is a hidden gem.....try it

Our first experience here was fantastic!  We will absolutely be back.  We tried the Matador roll and the TNT roll.  The rolls were both equally amazing.  I'll probably be dreaming of the Matador roll.  I'll be back for it soon.  And I'll for sure order the TNT roll again.  My husband, craving his version of comfort food ordered the fried rice.  It was packed full of shrimp and meat.  Our waitress, Taryn was friendly, attentive and helpful.  The restaurant was clean and inviting.  The wait was shorter than expected.  Overall the ambience is right up my alley.  Lively yet intimate with outdoor seating.  I can't wait to go back and I'll definitely be recommending this to my friends.
I love this place. Great food, cheap and never too busy. Me and my boyfriends favorite spot!

I had lunch on a Sunday and the service and food were very good. There is a pleasant outside patio area, that while small and enclosed, is a great idea for an outside fair weather meal. The sushi was very fresh and the specialty items and rolls were imaginative and tasty. They also have fresh wasabi (has kind of a pickle relist consistency) that is good. I'd also recommend the etamame.  The service was attentive, polite and knowledgeable about the offerings. It's a little pricey (on the outside of $$), but you do get what you pay for here.

The BEST meal I've had in a long time!!! Our waitress Liz was knowledgeable, prompt, and very, very kind! We had the Thai mussels, Tuna sushi, Mongolian beef, orange chicken,  and three different rolls. She asked if we left room for dessert (which we hadnt) but we had a birthday at the table so we went all in. It was incredible!! Everyone had a great meal and talked about the next time we would be coming back and who we would bring with us!! So So good!!!!

In AZ you know going in your sushi options are limited and should be graded on a curve. That being said this is damn good sushi and can stand up to most anywhere. So happy to finally have a go to spot for great sushi in the east valley!

Ordered takeout from here on Mother's Day and it was FANTASTIC! You never know about takeout sushi, but I was craving it and not they didn't disappoint. Guy who answered the phone was super nice and helpful, order was right on time, everything was right and they gave me plenty of sauce/wasabi/ginger/chopsticks. Also, the presentation of the sushi was beautiful and the fish couldn't have been fresher. My only complaint was I didn't order enough!!! Definitely trying more next time and will try actually eating at the restaurant too!!! Oh, and the fresh wasabi was delish!

I love, love, love the restaurant, the food and most of the staff at Otaku, but there are times when they make mistakes on the order or the service is slow ... glad they finally redid their menu so it is not so huge (I mean size, not number of items). PS: Whatever that pineapple mojito type drink they have is SO yummy too!

Best sushi I ever had!  We took the entire family for my birthday.  Since it was a party of 6, we had a lot of different sushi!  We left stuffed.   The decor is really neat as well.  I think the key is not to go at peak time.  We arrived at opening, I think 11 a.m.  Everything was fresh and everyone was well satisfied.  My husband had a bento box.  The gelato was great... we were divided between green tea and mango flavor!

Management followed up to my restaurant experience and review. They were very nice, kind, listened, and apologized. They offered an invitation to their restaurant again which I declined. I appreciate they took the time to acknowledge my concerns and experience as this will only help them going forward.

Absolutely love this place!  Always great service.  The sushi is always fresh, we love sashimi and have never been disappointed.  I love a restaurant that has specials, and Otaku always has specials.  On the weekend you can try 5 delicious  items from the small plate menu for $20.  Try the fresh wasabi, you won't be disappointed.  They serve a great pineapple mojito as well!

Arrived at the tail end of Happy Hour on a Friday. Confusion at the hostess stand when we arrived and more confusion as to who was actually serving us.  Scallop Poppers were yummy and sweet but my husband had to pick too much "bad lettuce" out of his Seaweed Salad (I would've sent it back).  Pomtini was deelish but the Iced Tea was from the fountain (not fresh-brewed; yuck); ice water was foul as well. Off the dinner menu, went with the Tiger Roll (pretty tasteless), Monster Roll (which was sitting in a heap of Chiptotle Mayo and that's all I tasted) and the Red Blossom Roll (spicy; best of the 3). Sushi was served without soy sauce dipping dishes and we had to wait 'til the server stopped back to get some; then, the soy sauce pots were empty. Ugh. We used a Groupon so the overall tab wasn't too bad but I'd never be tempted to drive out of my way here again. Sorry.

I'm a little late on writing this review but I just had to give this place 5 stars!  It was Valentine's Day and I had forgot to make reservations.  I called at the last minute and the squeezed me in .. we didn't order the 'standard' Valentine's Day menu they offered, we just did our regular thing.  Some sashimi and a couple of sushi rolls.  The services was great, the food was fresh as always and we had a great evening!  This place is fantastic and I highly recommend them!

So happy we found this place on here! Outstanding sushi in a beautiful contemporary setting. I had both my kids and still felt very much at home even though the place looks like a high end hot spot. We had a mix of sashimi, rolls, and dinner entrees and everything was very fresh and flavorful. This is definitely our go to sushi place in Chandler!

My go to Sushi spot.  The Deluxe Shashimi platter is always a 10.  Of all the places I ha e tried in Phoenix, Otaku always delivers.   Friendly staff and great atmosphere.   Watching sports while siting at the main Sushi bar area is the best.

The atmosphere is fresh, open and friendly.  The food has a mix of both classic and unique items.   My favorite appetizer is the calamari, it's light with a slight spicy crumb.  It's delicious. Tip, they offer a great lunch menu at a reduced price
I feel lucky to live so close! Went for a girls night and we all enjoyed our meals and sushi. Excellent service and nice atmosphere.

The food is so so. The decoration is good. The food is very pricey. Don't believe me? Try order two pieces of Tobiko with Quail egg see how much you have to pay. Very thin crowd, about four tables during lunch.0

Had dinner tonight with my wife and the service and food was outstanding. The Dynomite roll was delicious as well as the Dragon Roll. The fried cheesecake was a great way to cap off our dinner.  Our server Savannah was outstanding!! Looking forward to date night next week.

I used to live overseas in Asia for 2 years, and despite the wonderful sushi there, this place is probably in my top 5 best sushi restaurants. I went with my boyfriend around 2 months ago, it is very casual which is nice, and not too expensive. We got a few rolls, including the Mardi Gras which is really unique and delicious! Very clean inside and outside, and friendly staff. I've only been to this sushi place in the Chandler but can already say this is the best one around! Can't wait to get back!!!!

Sushi and service were good, but the entrees weren't up to par, even Panda Express is better for Chinese dishes. The specialty cocktails sounded creative but weren't very good either. The staff members were very nice and the ambience of the restaurant was great but unfortunately we won't be returning.

ASK FOR THE FRESH WASABI. I'd never even seen fresh wasabi before, now I can't get enough. I am so super thrilled to have found this place. We've gone for family outings and for date nights, we were massively impressed on both occasions. The staff is amazing. Also...you wouldn't think about sushi restaurants having deserts but they just came out with a special fall season roll...I think there is pumpkin pie in there. I would recommend this place to anyone.

We have been patrons of this place for the last 3 years, had excellent service and meals......... the last 2 visits were just ok, always seem to be out of amaretto,  any who. This last visit was unacceptable! We were seated and at least 10 minutes and NO SERVICE,  not even a visit from our server. Granted it seemed that there was only 1 wait person that we saw, but c'mon! There were only a handful of tables that were there before us,  and a table that wasn't even cleared that we passed by, was occupied and served as we walked out!!! NO THANKS OTAKU....we drove on down the road to Osaka and had a great meal and service.

This sushi is very pricey compared to other nearby better sushi places (sushiya) the spicey tuna had a very dark color to it , and very fishy smell and taste couldn't even eat , I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone ,

Have been there 2x now for Sushi & it's all been good some rolls better than others but we're exploring the menu.  Not just sushi they have a large menu featuring oriental dishes. Decent service too so we will be back.

For me customer service is 1st and the taste/quality of the food is 2nd.  The bartender Codi (female) was super awesome! She made a custom gin drink for me + she was very familiar with the menu + she looked and sounded like she loved her job + we sat at the bar btw  I ordered a plain salmon roll, miso soup, and a cocktail with gin.  Codi asked me a few questions about the types of drinks I like and she made my cocktail as close to it as possible & she checked in with us regularly. My salmon roll was great, the fish tasted pretty fresh.   Really, I have no complaints.... I went during a regular time but looking forward to visiting this place again!

Pretty restaurant. Waited 20 minutes for one drink and another 5 minutes to find out my cocktail was not available (from their cocktail list) as they were out of the right ingredients. Our tiny, but tasty calamari appetizer was finished before our drinks arrived. My gin and tonic was $7 and made with just a splash of tonic and no lime- not good, unless you wanted a shot of gin.  We received our neighbor's food and then waited another ten minutes for our entree. All of the food was quite tasty, the prices were a bit high. The service was disjointed and quite frustrating.  We will return, but not for a few months and not without some kind of a discount.

I have eaten at several sushi restaurants in the east valley and in Scottsdale, but I haven't found any that have the quality of fish Otaku does. The entire staff are so friendly and make us feel like we are a part of their family every time we come in. We love that we can order special rolls and make up our own as we go. Jesus, Travis, and Jack are very talented and we love sitting up at the sushi bar to watch the food art they create. Otaku is my happy place and I look forward to going in every week!

No thank you. Dining area felt dirty, wasn't crowded but looked like they hadn't cleaned after the lunch rush ...?  Waitress smelled like smoke.  Had appetizers and drinks- absolutely nothing special. Will not be back.

Was impressed with the nice and classy interior, and our server was very nice and accommodating. Ordered sashimi which tasted great but was too small of a portion considering the hefty price. We also ordered several rolls, out of which the cheeto roll was the most interesting and satisfactory. However, I was disappointed with the spicy salmon and spicy tuna. They were not very tasty or spicy or fresh. Will definitely come back to try other things.

When we pulled up and I saw the name I simply thought wtf... The decor isn't very Japanese more Chinese and the menu also has tons of Chinese food also... The service was really god and the sushi chefs were cool as hell... So far this is the only place in Arizona I haven't complained about the sushi... It's not the greatest but I thought it was cool... so in my opinion its A-OK

Arrived at 815p, plenty of time before closing, not busy 4-5 other tables. The place is beautiful and our server ( the bartender) was friendly. Unfortunately, the food was extremely average; the miso soup was very salty, the rolls stomach able. We ordered 2 rolls; one came out in a reasonable time, the other took FOREVER ( 2 tables after us came, ate, and left)!! $80 later (2 rolls, 2 sake bombs, 1 miso, 1 appetizer), definitely not worth. We are sitting at home eating Wendy's, disappointed and still hungry.
My new favorite lunch spot.  Oooooohhhhh soooo good!  I ordered the Panko Bento Box lunch and it was delicious.  Our waitress was super nice.

I wouldn't say my experiences with Otaku have been BAD per se... I'm a returning customer, so obviously I can't say it was terrible.  I think, moreso, it was just average.  The ambiance is nice, definitely a large open space. There's a bar and a sushi bar, and both are always pretty busy.  Our server seemed a little lost. He didn't remember my mom, who thinks she some sort of a Regular, so even though she thought he knew what "the usual" meant, he didn't. We ended up getting some random appetizer, which was not "the usual". I'm not sure why he wouldn't just say that he didn't remember, and needed to be reminded of what she wanted.  Odd.  We had some shrimp stuffed Tofu, with some sort of tempura. Not good. They have you dip it in this random sugary substance. I dunno, maybe I was doing it wrong, but I didn't get the appeal.  Also had some battered scallops or something? Not good.  Las Vegas Roll is awesome, I can't hate on it. Squid Salad was also very tasty. And, if you've got a sweet tooth, DEFINITELY check out the tempura cheesecake. Ugh, so good!  Management is cool, they came around a couple times to see how we were doing.

This was our third time here and the best so far. I try to give places 2-3 times before making a real assessment unless it's obviously a bad spot. First time was 4 stars, last time was 3 stars and this time was 5 stars for sure.  Orange chicken, beef and broccoli, scallop poppers, and a couple of rolls. All delicious and good service.

I really want Otaku to survive.. the location is great and the service is usually amazing.  Despite our better judgement.. we have this place another try (ok.. more like 20 tries).  Our last order "to go" was so messed up that we had to go back to the restaurant not once.. but TWICE to correct the order.   The servers are always accommodating but it's time this restaurant takes care of the kitchen.
Been going here for a couple years with my family.  Otaku has best sushi in the east valley!

This place opened a couple of years ago. It is close to my house, but early reviews were not promising. My wife and I have been reluctant to try, but last night, decided to go for it. We arrived about 4pm and wanted to take advantage of happy hour. Drafts were a buck off and a few rolls and appetizers, were discounted. The place was empty and I had to wipe off crumbs from my chair before I sat down. We noticed many of the chairs were filthy. Anyway, we found a few things we could agree on and ordered. We started with an assortment of tempura battered shrimp, veg and calamari. Looked pretty and we dove in. We both took a piece of calamari from the pile. My wife took a bite first and waited for me. She thought something wasn't right, but wanted to see if I had same reaction. I dove into that piece of calamari. Oh dear God, what the hell. Major taste and smell of ammonia. I spit out and called over the waitress.  I told her what we were experiencing. She was nice and offered to get us something else. We told her that were were not comfortable eating sushi now that we know the cooked food is not good. The manager came over to us and smelled the calamari on my plate. She was appalled at what she smelled. It was ammonia folks. Not sure if they spilled cleaning solution on the food or if this was just bad calamari?? Needless to say, we walked out. We will not be going back. I don't know how the chef couldn't smell this rancid crap before he battered and fried. Maybe he just doesn't care about killing someone? Nice job Otaku---you win the "Suck" award!
Great place for lunch! Had a great time, could of had a happy hour though or special. Drinks were a little pricey.

Otaku has been my favorite place for sushi in Gilbert since 2015. The fish is always fresh and their rolls are unique combinations that are well thought out for their flavor profiles rather than just throwing a bunch of random ingredients together like other places. If you are not into sushi, they have  an extensive menu that caters to any palette. My personal favorites include the Tom Yum and the Galbi Short Ribs. This time I had two new experiences at Otaku that made my visit even better. The raw Kumamoto oysters were so delicate and delicious my mouth still waters thinking about them. And they have a new Manager Jenny that came over the check in on our experience. She was very friendly and bubbly. It was like having a conversation with a friend, not with just a restaurant manager checking in on us! I look forward to going back again soon!

We come here often and the service is consistently great!  Front of house staff go out of their way to make us feel special each time we come.  The Pomtini is always masterfully created and delicious without being too sweet.  I also highly recommend the Singapore style noodles.  Our kids have some minor special requests that are handled without issue each time.  They have a lot of great rolls - the hot n messy is delicious!  Always a great experience!

Very delicious and friendly! They do happy hour every day which is so great! The sushi is always very delicious and the same with their entrees. I love how close this is to my house. We visit this place quite frequently!
Mediocre sushi at a premium price.  The restaurant is pretty nice and upscale feeling but the sushi just wasn't worth the cost.  If you go only go during happy hour.

Great sushi!! Great food! Great staff! Michael has taken care us twice and is a ROCKSTAR! We have had a perfect experience both times we have visited. This is our new favorite sushi spot. Keep it up guys!

This is one of our go-to places on a busy Friday night. They always have seating where the wait time is minimal. The food is always amazing! I suggest the Tootsie Roll and the Cheetah Roll - my two faves! I always get soy paper on my rolls and let me tell you it is nice and thin, unlike some other sushi places that serve really thick soy paper.   Their Miso soup is very good too. Drinks are great and the staff is always so kind. We even get take out sometimes and when we get it home, it tastes just like it does when you choose to dine in. We like this place a lot and will continue to spend our Friday nights and money here.
The ambience is good..good selection of sake. I wasn't too crazy on the sushi . wasn't as fresh as I wanted it to be. Since its closeby,I will visit again.
Wow. What an awesome Sushi place.  Happy Hour from 3-6. Great sushi and shashmi.  Wait staff was excellent.  Come and try this place.  You won't be disappointed!!

Just moved to the area and I think we've found our sushi spot! I can only review the raw stuff as we haven't had any of their cooked food. The fresh scallop sashimi is awesome. The only dish I probably won't order again is the Chirashi. I was looking forward to getting a bowl of warm rice topped with a chef's selection of raw fish, similar to other sushi restaurants I've been to, but I was disappointed to see poke over rice on a plate. Oh well.

Had the best lunch. Chicken, salad, and sushi were all very good. The manager was very nice and helpful and the service was great as well. The restaurant was clean and very nicely decorated. We can't wait to go back.

The are now open on mondays, went in for lunch, i  had the wonton soup, and bacon wraped shrimp.  Great food.  Big bowl of wonton soup,  has shrimp and  pork in it very filling. And the bacon wraped shrimp were very good.  It was my second time here and both the food and service  are great.  I will keep coming back.
Good sushi. Very creative rolls. Very attentive service. Thursdays are ladies night:)
Pretty decent. Very N Scottsdale feel down in Chandler. If I had something really unique or special I would give it 5 stars. Still good solid sushi place. Friendly. I'll be back.

I want to preface this review by saying that I'm close friends with one of the sushi chef's in training, so we got a seat right at the sushi bar and really had a great opportunity to chat.  That being said, I will review this strictly on the quality of food, since we received some deep discounts due to being VIP guests.  (C'mon now, you know you all get discounts too when you personally know the staff/chefs, so quit your whinin'!)  The quality of the fish was excellent... some of the best sushi I've had in my existence.  The key to getting good sushi is to trust in the chef, and ask them what is fresh, and what they would suggest (omakase style).    We had a sashimi appetizer platter to start which featured blue fin, yellow tail, o-toro (yes, the good stuff!), and a few other pieces.  Served with fresh wasabi root (not the hydrated green powdery stuff), this appetizer really woke our stomachs and senses.  We had a few different rolls per the chef's suggestion, and all were spectacular (including some off the menu rolls).  The kim bap roll was highly recommended, and the quality was definitely memorable, better than most Korean-mom kim bop rolls I've had in my life.  We asked for ama-ebi (sweet shrimp), which was soft, tender, and sweet, with perfectly fried shrimp head to back.  This was the first time I've had such perfectly made ama-ebi, and it's made me want to continue my search in Chicago.  Some tasty mochi desserts, a few bottle of sake, and all in all, it was a very enjoyable night for my compadres and I.    I'm sorry for those that have found a bad experience at Otaku, as it sounds like most of it is waitstaff issues... but as a sushi fanatic, my advice to you is this:  1.  Don't ask for a table if you're party is smaller than 4... ask for a spot at the sushi counter, because that's how sushi is meant to be served.  Getting to know your chef, the chef getting to know you, having drinks together, etc.    2.  Ask the chef what he/she recommends.  Not all fish are equally fresh, and the chef will know what's best for the day.  And if you can provide them with your own past experience of what you liked/didn't like, they'll likely craft a sushi experience for you that you'll love.  Verdict:  If only Otaku were in Chicago... I might go broke.  Delicious sushi, and worth a visit!
My wife and I love this restaurant. We frequent many sushi places in the Phoenix area and this is our favorite spot! Nice atmosphere.
This was a nice neighborhood find. Good sushi and a cool atmosphere. Friendly waitstaff. We had gyoza and sushi rolls. Both were very good.

I went in on a Sunday, not really busy. I was excited to try this place because of their wonton soup. I went in with high expectations. Soup was good but not out of this world and shrimp weren't clean, at least the ones that came in my soup. Small portions, orange chicken was more of a sweet and spicy. Customer service was not really there. We waited a long time to get our drink order taken, and food was also a bit of a wait for the restaurant's lack of customers. Overall will not be going back.

Went here to check out happy hour with family.  Nothing that really stands out.  Prices were comparable to other happy hour spots but nothing too memorable when it comes to the sushi.  The restaurant has a nice little flow as the bar is in the middle of the action.  Clean all around and the service was very good.  I would go back if invited to meet up but not a choice that I will revisit.  Sorry.
Love this place! The sushi is fresh, and there is a wide variety to choose from. The entrees are great, the house hot sake is the best.

This is my 5th visit  to this spot. Other visits did  not necessarily disappoint....  however, tonight's dinner/ happy hour was lack luster, to the point that I question coming back. Service was slower than usual, and drinks took FOREVER to arrive. Excuse, upon excuse later..... our drinks arrive and orders are taken. 3 sushi rolls, 1 order calamari, and a kid's  lo mein. Lo mein was flavor less, under seasoned(daughter  barely touched it, she normally finishes  her plate). Sushi was not as delicious  as we remember.  Calamari NEVER CAME.  I'm so bummed as this place is literally a minute from my house. To  make matters worse, second round of drinks took easily 12-15 mins to arrive..... didn't even have anything to numb the pain from this sad, sad experience. I don't know if I'll return, this visit  sure let me down. I guess I'll have to find a new sushi spot nearby.

My husband and I love this place. Great atmosphere and super friendly staff ! Zach is a great manager who always greets us by name and makes us feel welcomed. I love their lychee martini and you can't go wrong with their cheetah roll !

Gluten free menus available. Not a ton of options but they also have gluten-free soy sauce. Great atmosphere and great service. Prices are a little high for the quality. Multiple pieces of my sashimi still had the skin on. Great place for socializing, business meetings, or date nights. Nice bar with tv, full bar options, and several beers on tap.

Always a great option to fulfill our sushi cravings... Service is always on point and the crowd is usually manageable with no long wait times for a table or the arrival of food. I would love to see some new specialty rolls since they seem to keep the sushi menu the same all the time. We've been here a number of times, ordered take out a number of times and we are always really satisfied.
Beautiful Decor but the food is below average. Don't expect too much except a great looking place.
I went here for lunch last week and got my same ol' Bento Box. The chicken was back to being awesome! So at this point... -1 star for inconsistency?

The food is absolutely to die for! Everything on the menu is amazing! I've never had anything that didn't taste great. The service is always wonderful too, the staff is very friendly and on top of their game! Its some of the best sushi I've ever had. The cheetah roll is AMAZING!  Pretty much everything in the menu is. It's a great place for lunch and dinner!! Highly recommend eating here!!

This place is nice. Really, really nice. I came here for lunch and ordered up a bunch of sushi, and the service was great. Every single person who was employed here took a minute to at least say hi to me, and the environment was really warm (maybe just because it was slow, but it was impressive nonetheless). I never wanted for anything- the sushi chef was extremely attentive and personable, and my server made sure that my tea was hot, my water was topped-off, and a smile was on my face.   The sushi was fine. Full disclosure- I had JUST brushed my teeth before coming, so I had a little bit of a minty mouth when I sat down to eat and I'm sure that affected the taste a bit. The unagi was perfect- oh-so-slightly crispy at the edges, succulent and warm in the middle with a very nice, unobtrusive sauce. The shiromaguro also had a really nice sauce to it, which I'm not used to on white tuna- but it was really nice. The ikura seemed a little bland, without the pleasing brininess and juicy pop that I usually enjoy. I will say that I was a little disappointed in the snow-crab used in the California rolls- usually when you see specific crab labelled it comes out as a solid stick of scrumptious leg-meat, but this was shredded and possibly from the claw, without much flavor. The rice was fine, but could have been a little more vinegared... but like I said, my tastebuds were a little off-center, so I'll have to come here again before I can really evaluate it.  All that being said, the exceptional friendliness of the staff was more than enough reason to give this place a solid four star. Maybe I just caught them on a good day, but service like that needs to be recognized! Thanks folks!
The sushi is over priced, must be expensive rent factor kicking in for mediocre sushi.  I'll take my business to the newly opened Osaka!
Fancy place with nice ambience, but food was not great.We went on a Saturday evening and wait time was about 20mins. We ordered a sushi roll and chicken teriyaki and both were not upto the mark.

This was a great sushi restaurant! Loved their small little tapas. Their rolls were delicious. We got the one with Cheetos in it. Oh my goodness so good. Never would have thought about eating flaming hot Cheetos in my sushi roll. Extremely creative rolls. The atmosphere was great. Service was good. Food was delicious. Looking forward to going back.

Second time at this resturant and was happy after both. Staff was nice and friendly along with the owner who was walking around and talking to each table. My wife had sushi and loved it and it was priced well. I got the Mongolian beef asked for it spicy and it was delicious. They also gave us a free edamame when checking in with yelp. The restaurant is very clean and a great bar if you like beer, wine or a  martini.  Only thing I didn't like was how loud the music was at some points. I will definitely be going back to this place!!!

We haven't been here is awhile and now I remember why. If you really know and like your sushi/sashimi this is not the place to go, but on the other hand if you like Asian cooked foods then its OK. My party of 3 dined here and a Saturday night around 7:30. The place was filled. Atmosphere very nice. Our server Tracy was excellent.  We ordered mainly Sushi: Uni (sea urchin), Salmon, Smelt Roe with Quail Eggs. We also ordered a Hamachi Sashimi and a Otaku Wrap along with a Tom Yum Hot Pot.   The best part of the meal was the service and the Tom Yum Hot Pot (though we ordered the soup "thai hot" and was not at all). The sushi was so over priced and disappointing. Fish slices were so thin almost transparent and was pack with a huge HUGE amount of dry sushi rice. The Otaku Wrap had so much sauce on it you couldn't taste the fish. The Smelt Eggs were good, but again way too much rice. The Uni was excellent in quality but at $14 an order, that is the highest price I have ever have paid in Arizona. In the past I've had their cooked foods, the Crispy Walnut Shrimp and the Orange Chicken, which were not bad.  Atmosphere very nice, service excellent, cooked foods OK, sushi/sashimi, I'll pass!

We decided to return to give this Otaku another shot and we were not disappointed! The service was on point, the food was phenomenal, and the ambience is like nothing else in Gilbert. This fish tank they have by the entrance is beautiful and you can tell they take great care of all the animals.  We had the Superman roll, the Strawberry roll (my favorite), spicy tuna roll, and the Red Blossom. All of them had great flavor and the fish was very fresh. I also had the pineapple mojito. It was great. Our waiter also informed us that they grow their own mint on the patio! Very cool.  We will definitely return and be sure to bring family and friends next time!

Came here for lunch and got the Bento box with the Seafood Otaku. Delicious. Colleague of mine got the Chirashi bowl her only complaint was the fish was a little warm due to it being placed over the rice vs. the veggies. Other than that everything was great.

HUGE restaurant... You are greeted at the door by friendly waitstaff and cooks behind the counter. I got the salmon lunch bento box and was very happy. It was delicious. There are several bento boxes to choose from and I'm sure they all taste great.  Manager even walked around ensuring everyone was enjoying their meals, which in my humble opinion is a good sign of caring service.   Don't forget to check in on Yelp for a complimentary now of warm yummy edamame.
Great ambience, amazing service and delicious food.  Can't go wrong for a date night here.

This restaurant is very close to my house and I eat here all the time. The people who work here are very nice.  The food is excellent!  All of the fish here tastes really fresh.  Love this place.  Yummm!
The service is outstanding and the food is wonderful! My husband and I come here all the time.  The management and the staff is friendly and helpful.  The mardi gras roll is amazing!

For starters, I love sushi. It's amazing. So when there's a new sushi place that opens up near by I like to give it a go; and seeing as how it was valentines weekend I decided I would take my wife out to dinner for some sushi. We live near by, so I figured we would go to Otaku and see what the fuss was all about. After all, they have pretty decent reviews so far and it looked pretty promising.   I had the foresight to call ahead because apparently the restaurant was full. I got a reservation for 7:45, showed up ten minutes early and we were seated promptly. The place was packed, the hostess wasn't kidding, they sure were full. It wasn't surprising that it was hard to get a table, because for a decent size restaurant, they have hardly any tables. Probably 70% of the seating is at two giant bars, one is more of a sports type bar with a bartender, and the other is a sushi bar where you can watch the chefs attempt to make sushi (more on that later). The atmosphere of the bar is very nice if a tad to loud. It seems like it can't decide if it wants to be a high end sushi joint, or a sports bar. And the problem is that the restaurant isn't big enough to effectively be both. So you get the dinner seating right next to the sports bar with loud music playing. There is high quality workmanship and very contemporary/modern design elements all around. I shudder to think about how much it cost them to build it, it's beautiful inside. It almost seems like they're trying too hard to be modern however, as they even use IPads for their POS system. Which sounds like a cool idea, but after observing the waitress try to use it for a while I noticed they don't have a cash drawer attached to them, which means they have to ring up the checks, print out a receipt, then walk to wherever the cash drawer is hidden and get the change. They also didn't seem to work with credit cards too well because they were manually typing in a lot of numbers when the cards wouldn't swipe properly.  All of this would be OK if I didn't run into a headache in every other aspect of our first and last visit to Otaku. Our server was Yuko and she did a very poor job. She took our order, brought us some water and ran away. She only returned once to give us refills. She returned really quickly with our tempura appetizer... too quickly in fact, as we learned that she actually stole another tables app... oops. The tempura was pretty good, although it was quite oily. Once we were done with it, we began the wait for our food... and we waited... and we waited... and eventually Yuko came by to tell us that the kitchen is running a bit slow tonight (no shit). That's fine I thought, it happens. Then we saw her socializing with a table full of drunks and wondered if it was actually the kitchen or her that we should worry about. We decided it was her, when we noticed that a table that was seated after us, and ordered after us, got their sushi ten minutes before we did! All this time Yuko was nowhere to be found. In the long run we ended up waiting 30 minutes after we finished our appetizer to get our sushi.  We only ordered two rolls: a California and a Vegas roll. The final nail in the coffin is that the Vegas roll was cold when we got it! It had clearly been sitting out for a good 10-15 minutes before it got to our table as it was room temperature and chewy. Beyond the texture, there was absolutely nothing special about it, certainly nothing to justify it's 9 dollar price. The California roll was just as generic as well. I've had better sushi at Teharu in Tempe, and it's a freaking serve yourself conveyor belt.   By this point my wife and I were pissed off, so we told Yuko that we were in a hurry and we needed the check. She then gave us the check and never returned. In the ten minutes between getting the check and us walking out cursing the name Otaku, I saw her busy counting her tips and socializing with her table full of drunk customers, who I'm sure she realized were the only people that would be stupid enough to actually tip her that evening.  This place clearly has a lot of kinks to work out, and the lack of stars in this review is all due to Yuko. I don't know if it would be any better with a different waitress, but I don't think i"m going to worry about finding out. There are a ton of choices for mediocre sushi in the valley and I'm past the point of giving places multiple chances to win me over. I'm guessing all the other five star reviews for this restaurant were from people to drunk to notice how bad it actually is.

Tonight we had the best service,  we had a table of 7 and our waitress was wonderful.  The food is fantastic.   Sashimi was so fresh it was delicious !  We had lollypop, and shrimp tempura, muscles, rolls, and low main.  Great place,  romantic and very clean! Highly recommend it!

Soft opening, so still working out the kinks. Food was deelish.  Scallop poppers- crispy and spicy; not at all greasy Honey chicken-a little sticky but so good Teriyaki chicken-subtler than other places' teriyaki, but much better flavor and chicken was tender "tootzi" roll- bursting with flavor and rolled perfectly Nice touches with cucumber water, upscale Asian decor, unique glasses, menus, plates, etc. Will definitely be back.

Went here on a date for the first time and Lindsay and the sushi chef made th best drink and food recommendations. We had a great time. I would suggest sitting st the sushi bar! The spicy margarita is VERY spicy watch out it's sooooo good

Otaku has been my go to sushi bar ever since they open their doors in 2010. My best description to others was a high end Scottsdale sushi restaurant located in the Southeast Valley.  The sushi always top notch, the chefs knowledgeable and creative,  the servers friendly,  and the manager on duty making sure everyone was welcomed and happy. Many regulars like myself. Well, no more. All new staff with no clue what is happening around them. Rolls that are good, for a chain sushi restaurant.  Tuna sushi served with a brown-red appearance and for the first time in my life required me to remove the inedible portions out of my mouth. I tried to get to get my bartender-server's attention and after 15 minutes gave up and called to get the manager. Guess who was manager. Kept trying to politely get his attention to leave and after another 15 minutes made a point of placing my credit card on the lip of my glass. Still no reaction u till a new bartender came on an I had to stand up and in a angry voice state I want my check now so I can get the hell out of here. As my check was ran up other customers asked what that was all about and they heard this complete story. For eight years I was an ambassador for Otaku but I cannot and will not  recommend this restaurant since it would be a great disservice to anyone who enjoys good sushi. Good bye Otaku and I hope after you close your doors a real sushi restaurant will find their way here. Sad.
Typically a favorite our ours but last night we got to-go and it was subpar. Sushi was room temperature.

Went here tonight on a date with my BF.  I was pleasantly surprised with the atmosphere, service, and food.  All the ingredients were fresh and yummy. The Chow Mein was the best I have had in years.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.   I would give the one sushi roll, Golden Cali Roll, we got a 3.. it was just ok. The BF liked it more than me.

Very good Asian restaurant with beautiful stonework inside and a comfy patio. Full Asian menu of Chinese, Japanese and some Thai dishes. I had mostly sushi and it was terrific, especially the white tuna on the sashimi salad. I'd definitely come here again. Order the Mio sparkling sake!
This is the best place for sushi. I have ordered several items and everything has been delicious.
Great find! Had the bento box and tried some sushi. Service was great and very accommodating with substitutions. Everything tasted amazing and very fresh.

This place would fit right into Scottsdale with its upscale looking decor.  Decent lunch options, although the lack of a broiled mackerel option is a little annoying (it's one of my favorites).  The fish was ok.  Decent for the desert, but nothing I can't find at a better price at a place with a little less ambition.

The first five star I have rated. And with a heavy hand, I can say with clear conscious that it is well deserved. Their delivery and presentation of food, drink, tea and sashami are artisian craft. The slices are perfect every time,  rare cuts of seabass and perfectly cured Saba (makeral). Every time is exciting (four times pre-yelp) and this time no different, the lunch special is perfect upper class bento box. The scenery and ambiance is perfect for a blooming Gilbert and Chandler cross roads. The glass patio is a being of magnificent architecture. The only fishy smell you get is from their gorgeous salt water tank.   Coming back now four times more- eight in all- I am happy to say that every time is money well spent. This place is an Arizona oasis for sushi and chef friendly gentlmen who know how to make anything. They make hand rolls and maki any way as requested.   Today I got a free edamame. Thanks to yelp.

Absolutely phenomenal! We came here this evening for dinner and it is hands down the best sushi I've had in Arizona since moving here. Do yourself a favor and order the Chimichanga rolls- oh my gah.  Owner and manager stopped by our table separately to check how everything was going. Both so kind and genuinely good people. I recommend taking advantage of their all-day happy hour on Sunday! Deals on EVERYTHING. We will absolutely be back. Worth the 25 minute drive!

Fantastic rolls, some traditional and several interesting new ones. Even if you think you won't like the Cheetah roll (because it has Flaming Hot Cheetos on it), try it anyway. It was awesome.  We also loved the Strawberry Cheesecake roll for dessert. Fantastic!  Great service, beautiful atmosphere and the owners are lovely people. What more could you want??

I had an overall good dining experience at Otaku. Very clean and upscale. The music was a touch loud. Service was prompt and polite. I ordered one of the dinner entrees, the Four Seasons. It was an interesting dish of steak, chicken, shrimp, and fish all served with rice. It was decent, pretty standard Asian cuisine. Next time I stop in I'll be sure to try from the extensive selection of sushi rolls. They looked phenomenal! Restaurant is equipped with a full bar from which I ordered a lemon martini, very sweet and tasty without the bite of the standard dirty martini. Otaku makes for a lovely night out with drinks, good food, and lively music. You no longer have to go all the way to Tempe for a good time! The manager introduced herself since we were first time customers and offered us a discount on our second visit.

Rolls were very tasty. My favorite was the dynamite, packed with flavor. The lover of salmon one was good, but more plain. The firey one wasn't overly spicy.   We upgraded our salmon nigiri pieces to king salmon for $1 more. It was good, but I don't really see how it was that much better. The piece maybe a couple centimeters longer, but not worth a dollar more.  The staff was nice. Waitress experienced.

This restaurant is around the corner from my office, and I'm so glad I found it.  Every time I go here for lunch, the food is consistently good. The atmosphere of the restaurant is beautiful and clean.   The sushi is delicious, and always tastes fresh. Their spicy tuna roll is my favorite.  I usually get the lunch bento box with miso soup and a dish called Seafood Otaku, which contains shrimp, scallops, and mixed vegetables in a spicy sauce.

This place had a great vibe. The restaurant appears very modern and styled well. The service was excellent. Everyone enjoyed watching football from the variety of tv screens. The food was also good. I ordered a rainbow roll which was ok. We also got a chicken curry, squid salad, and chow mein. The portions are very generous. You will go home stuffed and with left overs.

Just alright for me. The ambiance is nice. You can sit at the sushi bar or go over to the booths. I bought 2 rolls on happy hour and let me tell you I was disappointed. I ordered the Tuna roll and the Las Vegas roll. Tuna roll was on the plain side and the Las Vegas roll was just alright. Lacking in a bit of flavor and not on the savory side. This is a reminder for myself to not order those rolls again. My thoughts were that this was better than getting sushi from Safeway, but I've had better sushi at most places in Az.. It's better than store bought, but the question is... is it something I'll go back to?

I cant figure the 3 star people. This place is a solid 4.5 to me. I am a recently converted sushi fan and this place is great.   My recommendations would be the Cardinals Roll or the Otaku Tiger Roll. The Baked Mussels and Squid Salad are amazing on the appetizer menu. If you're not into sushi go with the French Style Beef Tenderloin has great flavor as well.  The service does leave something to be desired, but the decor is very nice and I didnt have an issue with the prices.
Otaku is so elegant and fun to dine at. Zach the manager is amazing and really friendly. Their array of food is the best.
Always good food! Make sure to ask about the dinner time bento boxes! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because of the noise/music levels. Gotta try it!

The last two times we have been here the service was so slow. The last time we  were greeted (kind of) and the host walked away without saying if there was a wait, how long the wait was, anything! It was so odd. We waited for some time and a different person finally came up to us (and a second family that was waiting) if we had been helped. We told her we were not really sure...
Good service.  Loved the cheetah.  Save room and go for the cheesecake roll for dessert, it's definitely worth it.

Great sushi and Asian menu! Chefs are always good abt customizations in the kitchen and at the sushi bar.   Very friendly staff, they tolerate and even entertain our children who hang out and run around the salt water tank!   My best friend and I love to share the Hot Pot, Singapore Noodles, Vegas Roll, and King Salmon Nigiri!

We've eaten sushi all over the valley since moving here last November.  To say the least we've been disappointed...until now.  Beautiful atmosphere, great service, and great rolls!  Very pleased that we've found our new sushi place!!!  I had the moondragon roll and it was amazing!!!  No picture because I scarfed it down so quickly!!

This place is fantastic, the service is amazing and the food is just as great. I got the Mardi Gras roll and it was incredibly fresh and filling. I definitely recommend this restaurant for affordable and tasty sushi!
Good sushi and nice ambiance. The modern decor would make this place a good casual date location. The sushi was good and prompt.  The appetizers were pretty tasty too. We will definitely be back.

Third time having lunch here and decided to finally write a review. I wasn't impressed the first 2 times but this time was frankly disappointing. If I am going to pay for high priced food (and their prices are high), the service needs to be better. Our waiter was nowhere to be found during our meal even though there were maybe 3 patrons in the entire restaurant. Our drinks were empty until I got tired of waiting and flagged someone else down for a refill. My miso soup had 1 piece of seaweed in it and hardly any tofu. The waiter suggested a side of rice with my sashimi but didn't tell me it was going to cost an extra $2 and I was charged extra for wasabi that I didn't ask for. Isn't wasabi supposed to come with sashimi and nigiri? Not a happy customer. I'll give them 2 stars because the restaurant is beautiful and the sashimi fish was good quality.

I have been here twice.  The food was  good and both times the service was good.  The server last visit was very helpful with selections with food and beverages.  Not the best sushi I have ever had but above average.  Decor is nice but looking for cooler weather to sit on the patio

update: We don't like the small portions high prices  less than average service sure the front door people smile, but  the sushi guys, and waiteress ughhhh... They actually try to make you feel like you haven't a clue Hispanic sushi guy didn't know if their eel was fresh water or  salt water, or if there was a difference , his words not mine. I   drove so far I figured  why not my kid got three over priced rolls which were good and to her liking.  I got  some tiny pieces of over priced sashimi that  lay flat on my taste buds, the ponzu is awful, and  the spicy tuna I had to beg to get in a hand roll because they didn't hear me the first time, I spent 100 with the tip.  sorry  sweet child of mine.  no can do. NEXT! We liked Hiro but it's so far from us and a  long long wait. too bad. We will keep trying, or break down and go back to Sakana which is usually what happens.

I love this place.  A tad off the "normal" path because it's between two main intersections, but make sure not to miss it.  The have about 15-20 standard sushi rolls you can find everywhere and then 15 or so rolls they came up with, which are amazing.  Highly recommended.  Closed Mondays so watch out for that.  We always go for the sushi, but all of the other food looks great also.

Otaku has THE best sweet and sour chicken.  My husband, who has traveled the world, says their sweet and sour chicken is the best he's ever had.  I love their sushi and have never had a mediocre dish here.
No fish smell, good food, good people.  The main thing you need to watch out in a raw sea food place is the smell. If you feel smell of fish it's because the fish is out there for a long time.

First reason I love this place is the friendly customer service! Someone always opens the door for you when you arrive or leave, and you are always welcomed in and greeted. Great sushi selection and bar layout. Always super clean. The fish tank up front is mesmerizing!

Well if you like to eat sushi in a loud annoying environment then this is the place for you.   I stopped for lunch and had my usual smoked salmon nigiri that I get at sushi places. It was ok nothing special.   The blaring music and screaming children made me really want to leave.   Does anyone want to listen Sean Paul's "Get Busy" while eating lunch?  It's a restaurant.  It's lunch.  It's not a nightclub.    Do people really think that loud music makes a place cool?  Never going back!

One of my favorites in the East Valley.  Consistent and absolutely awesome food.  The Thai mussels are wonderful, I have never eaten anything @ Otaku that wasn't awesome!  Talented sushi chefs and great service.
Baked muscles are amazing here! Order extra bread as the broth is to die for! We love the Cheeto roll! Try it you won't be disappointed!

Food was good, the staff was a little over concerned with another staff member that was eating with her friend. The staff member would go to the bar and make drinks for her friend, she would then come back and gossip. The place was not busy, but done be so obvious and ignore the people that are not staff. I don't think ill be back.
My go to sushi joint. Very friendly staff and great atmosphere but most importantly amazing food. Have never been disappointed and always recommend to friends and family!

Not for me. I got a curry chicken bento box and my boyfriend got honey chicken entree. Mine was very bland and the chicken wasn't cooked well. One of the worst bento boxes I've ever had. My boyfriend's honey chicken also had the chicken gone wrong taste.  The place looks super nice and fancy but man they need to spend some money on the chef too. Maybe their sushi could be good but we're not wasting our money there again.

I've been here before but something must have changed, the sushi was sub-par and service was slow. The ice in my drink melted before they refilled it. When the manager asked how we felt, we told him it was OK, and he walked away. Without the compassion, this restaurant is doomed. Sorry but I will not be visiting again.

We've been here twice and last time we came was a good experience. But this time we came here it was an amazing experience. We came here during the lunch special which we never had. I have to say it was an amazing deal. I will defiantly come here again during lunch. 11 bucks for sushi, rice, a main entree and others. Amazing deal! The servers kept checking up and they held the door open for us when we left. Customer service was phenomenal.

We dine here a couple times a month, because we love Robyn, the manager!  I don't know what this place would do without her.  We would not come here nearly as often if it weren't for Robyn.  She is always going around the restaurant talking with customers, making sure they are having a good dining experience.  The food and the ambiance is good too, it's just that personal service that makes it better!

We went for happy hour and had excellent service from friendly staff, and an overall positive dining experience.  Sushi was fresh, ramen was tasty, and the tempura was not bad (batter was a little heavy).    It's between this and Rock Lobster as the two best sushi places in South Chandler/Gilbert area.

The restaurant overall was fantastic! My first time going there was amazing. The food was unbelievable. Also, the raw sushi and the sushi was great. The place was very homey and the waiters/waitresses were very friendly.

Guessing from going there and seeing the menu that this is a Chinese run Japanese restaurant.   The Atmostphere is pleasant with a upscale Scottsdale feel. The staff is very friendly, but not overly friendly that they bug you and try to initiate conversation with you every chance they get.   We started out our order with Miso soup, which at first glance looked liked the package miso soup you would get at a Japanese grocery store, but with is quite tasty. Afterwards our orders for avocado roll, unagi roll, spicey tuna roll and my wifes beef chow fun came.  All the sushi was delicious and well prepped. The unagi roll was covered in a very potent Teriyaki sauce which I wonder how it will taste with chicken..perhaps next time.   My wife is a big fan of Beef Chow fun and enjoyed it.   Overall we were pleased with everything, and will make an effort to come back and try other items on the menu.   HOWEVER!...I like to finish off at sushi places with green tea ice cream and they did not have it:(

We came in mid-day during a slow time. Food was decent and service was excellent, the manager even gave us a 10% coupon for our next visit. Only gripe was the server sitting on the counter and sushi chef talking behind the sushi bar the entire time, including during the time while he was making our rolls. We both worked in the industry and perception is reality for the customers. Not sure if the atmosphere of the restaurant is always this laid back or it was because it was slow but we found it unprofessional.

Really cool spot that we found here. Always open to finding new spots and glad we did. The inside decorations are awesome with a pretty nice looking tree right behind the bar.   The cool thing is on the wall behind the booths is all this writing in Japanese it really pops well. The setup is nice and easy to get around with a sushi bar and regular bar to sit at.   The rolls are creative which always catches my attention. The one I loved was the cheetah roll with flaming hot Cheetos in it and on top of it.  Also got the Mardi Gras roll which almost felt like dim sum with what its wrapped in.    Overall we will back to enjoy this place.

Please note, this is my very first review of any kind.. I visited this sushi bar today with my son because he bought a 1/2 off groupon - off we went!  Very nice place, great ambiance... I was impressed, however wise enough to know that books AND restaurants shouldn't be judged on the surface. I frequent many sushi bars and some of the best sushi I've eaten can be found in much less elegant of establishments - don't be fooled!  We ordered 5 maki rolls to start:  2 from their 'signature' menu (firecracker roll and the madi gras roll) I love spicy food of all kinds - the firecracker roll was just HEAT, no FLAVOR, big upset. The madi gras roll was plain and flavorless. You'd be hard pressed to find a piece of lobster in there and they must have run out of cilantro because no tasty herb anywhere!! Keep in mind, these are signature rolls, $12+ a roll.   The other 3 rolls were from their 'traditional' selection.. We got the following: Las Vegas roll - ok, the sushi to rice ratio was about 20/80, not impressed at all. Eel roll - eel?? Where was the eel?  Spicy scallop roll - Zero spice and quite frankly it tasted like mushy rice.. The consistency was way off... Also take note that these 'traditional rolls' are no bigger than a quarter in diameter, very small for almost $10 per roll, ridiculous!!  Our waiter saw my puzzled look as he brought out these rolls and never once asked if there was a problem or how our food was when he brought the check.. Which brings us to $$ Our total was $55 for the most ridiculous lunch I've ever had.. Thanks, or NO thanks to the Groupon, we then owed $25 for really NOTHING more than an upscale environment!  Save your time and spare your disappointment by passing up this joint! My recommendations for great sushi, Blue Wasabi, Sakana and The Sushi Room.  Happy eating!

Very beautiful restaurant.  They have a very large menu, which is scary...  They have sort of an all encompassing Asian menu.  We had the salt and pepper pork, that was AWESOME!  Also, a couple common sushi rolls that were good, nothing crazy.  My wife had the tom yum and loved it.  Can't wait to go back.  Pricing is a little high...

Could not believe this place was so close to us and we never knew.  My wife and I went out for dinner and wanted to find somewhere new and interesting.  This beautiful establishment was exactly what we were looking for.  Crab puffs, cheers roll and four seasons seafood were just amazing.  Alex behind the bar was the perfect amount of friendly and attentive.  Pineapple Movoto's were amazing.  Loved loved loved the best kept sushi secret destination.  Let's not keep it secret any longer!
My wife and I both got food poisoning from Otaku's dirty, overpriced sushi. When I called to let the manager know I was blown off. Won't be returning here in the future.

Very nice presentation of dishes and helpful waitress. Food is a bit on the expensive side... Not worth the price. Spent 25$ and didn't feel full. The atmosphere is great because it's peaceful with the right amount of lightning.
Great sushi!  Get the new Zealand king salmon whenever it is on special.  Chefs will also wow you with custom creations.

This place came highly recommended so my wife and I were excited to try it.  Cute place with very friendly staff.  My wife had a sashimi plate and I had the lunch special Bento box with chicken kastu, gyoza, eggroll, spicy tuna rolls, miso soup, and salad.  Bottom line is food was incredibly mediocre.  A Tyson chicken nugget had more flavor than the katsu!  Two different sauces were available but they were just too sweet.  Portions were also quite small.  The sashimi wasn't as fresh as it could be and my wife began to feel queasy after eating it.  Again staff was very accommodating and friendly but the food itself was so subpar.

the restaurant itself was absolutely beautiful. i loved the interior. decorations, layout, ambiance, everything. i felt like i was in an upscale scottsdale restaurant. the food though wasn't so great. it was lacking flavor and was not satisfying. we ordered the last 2 rolls on the menu, which was the most expensive so we figured it ought to be good. but no, it wasn't! we also ordered the scallop poppers, which wasn't bad, but it had a distinct taste...we were still hungry so we were gonna order one more roll, but the food was so horrible we just decided to leave the restaurant hungry. we went to mcdonalds down the street and that was a lot more satisfying.   i still can't get over how beautiful this restaurant was! if only the food was better...
Fish was Really fishy ok sushi,Service very was good  sushi bar people were very helpful and nice. Would not come here again

Went to this place for dinner because one, it turned up on a chirashi search on Yelp. Two, the reviews seemed fair. Three, fusion could be interesting.  My order: green tea, smelt roe maki with quail egg (two pieces per order), Korean Beef Bowl.  My bill with tip: $29 and change.  Pros: Nice building and interior. Good atmosphere. Warm and prompt service.Modern and upscale feel. Generous serving size. My bowl was big enough for two. Sushi was fine.  Cons: Some of the ink on my menu was smeared. Some of the menu items were harder to read. One page came loose from the corner page holders. There was visible grease mark on a couple of pages. The drink menu had a clear smudge from some sauce on it. Not good. Not upscale. Hope I got the only menu with the problems. Need to pay attention to detail.  Green tea wasn't green tea.
